B3i2F2quKwnQnyiZ.name: Sneak Attack
B3i2F2quKwnQnyiZ.description: Scorched Earth orcs deal an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

baq48kLR5b2XdLuk.name: Tethered Shot
baq48kLR5b2XdLuk.description:
Frequency once per round

The Scorched Earth sharpshooter makes a ranged Strike, firing an arrow attached to a line at a creature in range.

If it hits, in addition to taking @Damage[(1d8+4)[piercing]] damage, that creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:23] save, with the following effects.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 minute or until it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes} (DC 23).

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature is pulled 5 feet toward the sharpshooter.

XEB79A5dsQFX25yf.name: Bushwhack
XEB79A5dsQFX25yf.description: Glorzia Strides up to 10 feet and attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} a creature she's undetected by. If she succeeds, she also deals fist damage to that creature.

Wduouw2belSvL4Xj.name: Mauler
Wduouw2belSvL4Xj.description: Glorzia gains a +3 circumstance bonus to damage rolls against creatures she has grabbed.

eu9kMN9JNocn50Zw.name: Guardian Construct Armor (Hardness 5)
eu9kMN9JNocn50Zw.description:
Like normal objects, the animated guardian has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness.

Once the animated guardian is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 13. It also loses its hardness.

ggo8dEkNuvsu7eRM.name: Guide's Warning
ggo8dEkNuvsu7eRM.description:
Trigger Tewakam is about to roll a Perception or Survival check to determine his initiative

Effect Tewakam visually or audibly warns allies, granting them a +1 circumstance bonus to their initiative rolls. Depending on how Tewakam warns allies, this action has the auditory or visual trait.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.UiISDbCjK6AUDsll]{Effect: Guide's Warning}

K9DEiC1oIoqDWUwg.name: Guiding Words
K9DEiC1oIoqDWUwg.description:
Tewakam points out a weakness of a creature within 30 feet. Tewakam and all allies that can hear or see him gain a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls against that creature until the beginning of Tewakam's next turn. Tewakam adds an extra 1d4 precision damage to his weapon and unarmed attacks that hit that creature during the duration.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.uqjx1bwYduHwwC7d]{Effect: Guiding Words}

j3ELc14hlrOyqOK9.name: Lead Cloud
j3ELc14hlrOyqOK9.description:
Trigger The leaded skeleton is hit by a melee attack

Effect A cloud of lead dust is released, forming a @Template[burst|distance:5]{5-foot radius} cloud of fine particles surrounding the skeleton. The cloud persists for 1 round, exposing creatures within it to an inhaled form of rapid lead poison.

mTwyXddJq3vxuscO.name: Rapid Lead Poison
mTwyXddJq3vxuscO.description:
High amounts of lead can cause headache, difficulty concentrating, and joint pain. Necromantic magic has augmented the lead that infuses this skeleton, causing it to take effect far more quickly than is typical for lead poisoning.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:20]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage,@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage, stupefied 1, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (2 rounds)

7vmhgd9oifizfpwo.name: Grasping Fingers
7vmhgd9oifizfpwo.description: The hand of Urxehl begins with 4 fingers embedded outside of the rift. At the beginning of the encounter, the hand is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened 1}, and can use this additional action to make grasping claw Strikes. For every 45 damage the hand of Urxehl takes, one of these fingers recedes and the hand loses 1 action, first losing the quickened condition, then becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} before being defeated at 0 Hit Points.

2ph7hoq3gg2wr6kx.name: Dominating Will
2ph7hoq3gg2wr6kx.description:
10 feet. A creature that enters the area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:28] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[2d6[spirit]] damage.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[4d6[spirit]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[8d6[spirit]] damage and is frightened 1 as long as the portal to the Abyss remains open.

kkibcb6my2j14udj.name: Thrash About
kkibcb6my2j14udj.description:
Trigger The hand takes enough damage to lose an action

Effect the hand thrashes about in pain, causing a minor earthquake. Creatures within 60 feet of the portal must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:28] save or be knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Peb58MTthihyfmEa.name: Soulsense 60 feet
Peb58MTthihyfmEa.description: A ravener senses the spiritual essence of living and undead creatures within the listed range. Creatures whose material bodies are one unit with their souls, like celestials and fiends, appear brighter to this sense.

9104lsyfyht93ak0.name: Boneshatter
9104lsyfyht93ak0.description:
Trigger The ravener husk takes bludgeoning damage

Effect The ravener's brittle bones shatter, spraying bone shards everywhere. Every creature within a @Template[emanation|distance:10]{10-foot emanation} of the ravener husk takes @Damage[6d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:27|basic|options:area-effect] save).

wvec977sf9tk4uj0.name: Breath Weapon
wvec977sf9tk4uj0.description:
The ravener husk breathes a torrent of void energy that deals @Damage[12d6[void]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:40] (@Check[reflex|dc:30|basic|options:area-effect] save).

They can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

E6yHKgr49GpD3BXa.name: Abyssal Knowledge
E6yHKgr49GpD3BXa.description: When a quasit offers Aid for an Arcana or Religion check, it gets the critical success result on any success and gets the critical failure result on any failure.

GdWAi69mvxSgSJOn.name: Virtue Aversion
GdWAi69mvxSgSJOn.description: The quasit's link to a mortal soul gave it birth, but it presents a vulnerability. Once per round, a creature can present an object related to something virtuous or good in the life of the quasit's creator (such as a beloved daughter's doll) as an Interact action to automatically deal the quasit @Damage[2d6[mental]] damage.

9boiwlXx7yggBu6F.name: Abyssal Healing
9boiwlXx7yggBu6F.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The quasit restores @Damage[1d6[healing]] Hit Points to itself.

PJbq8TKDuFGf9n7l.name: Barrow Quasit Venom
PJbq8TKDuFGf9n7l.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:20|traits:damaging-effect]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round).

6H24I1OnQd9t8zNU.name: Change Shape
6H24I1OnQd9t8zNU.description:
• Bat
      • Senses Echolocation 40 feet
      • Speed 15 feet, fly 30 feet
      • Melee fangs [[/r 1d20+10 #Fangs]]{+10}/[[/r 1d20+6 #Fangs]]{+6}/[[/r 1d20+2 #Fangs]]{+2} (agile), Damage @Damage[1d8[piercing]] damage
      • Melee wing [[/r 1d20+10 #Wing]]{+10}/[[/r 1d20+6 #Wing]]{+6}/[[/r 1d20+2 #Wing]]{+2} (agile), Damage @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning]] damage
    • Centipede
      • Speed 10 feet, climb 10 feet
      • Melee mandibles [[/r 1d20+10 #Mandibles]]{+10}/[[/r 1d20+5 #Mandibles]]{+5}/[[/r 1d20 #Mandibles]]{+0} (poison), Damage @Damage[2[piercing],1d6[poison]]{2 piercing damage + 1d6 poison damage}
    • Toad
      • Senses @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.rqfnQ5VHT5hxm25r]{Scent} (Imprecise) 30 feet
      • Speed 5 feet
      • Melee jaws [[/r 1d20+10 #Jaws]]{+10}/[[/r 1d20+5#Jaws]]{+5}/[[/r 1d20 #Jaws]]{+0}, Damage @Damage[2[bludgeoning]] damage
    • Wolf
      • Size Medium
      • Senses @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.rqfnQ5VHT5hxm25r]{Scent} (Imprecise) 30 feet
      • Speed 40 feet, climb 10 feet
      • Melee jaws [[/r 1d20+10 #Jaws]]{+10}/[[/r 1d20+5 #Jaws]]{+5}/[[/r 1d20 #Jaws]]{+0}, Damage @Damage[2d6[piercing]] damage plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.BCLvAx4Pz4MLa2pu]{Knockdown}

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

I7TPiY7nSjh8NCvV.name: Wishbound Vision
I7TPiY7nSjh8NCvV.description: The belker is accustomed to working together with the mist stalkers and ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from both smoke and mist.

hDgRV0F4vLYv4H9C.name: Smoke Form
hDgRV0F4vLYv4H9C.description: The belker can occupy the same space as other creatures.

Ebi8GNY5UeM9WeJ5.name: Noxious Fumes
Ebi8GNY5UeM9WeJ5.description:
Requirements The belker is occupying the same space as a Medium or smaller creature

Effect The belker attempts to flow into the creature's lungs; the creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:21] save. On a failure, the creature partially inhales the belker and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} by the pain of the smoke rasping in its throat and lungs. The creature can attempt to exhale the belker by spending an action coughing and succeeding at a @Check[fortitude|dc:21] save.

Most of the belker remains outside the creature, so the belker can still act normally. If the belker moves out of the creature's space or uses again, the creature automatically exhales it.

TbwDJPCnJc8ncoVB.name: Smoke Slash
TbwDJPCnJc8ncoVB.description:
Requirements The belker is partially inhaled by a creature

Effect The belker automatically deals its claw damage to the inhaling creature by forming a claw to slash and scrape the creature from within.

viQYjDAyUKgEOmaJ.name: Bloodfire Fever
viQYjDAyUKgEOmaJ.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:16]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 Enfeebled 1 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 day)

Stage 4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 day)

Stage 5 Enfeebled 2, Clumsy 2, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} (1 day)

hvk3jTMWT9RaDiBH.name: Pack Attack
hvk3jTMWT9RaDiBH.description: The frostbitten trollhound deals an extra 1d4 damage to creatures within reach of at least two of its allies.

KCIoNtvD8U1dgqiD.name: Handout Information
KCIoNtvD8U1dgqiD.description: In combat, Ogthup is a minion. Once per round, any PC can spend an action to command Ogthup (this has the auditory, concentrate, and linguistic traits), and have her take two actions. If reduced below 15 HP, Ogthup scampers away and dives into a snowdrift, to return once the coast is clear. If reduced to 0 HP, she falls unconscious rather than dying immediately.

IWyGR16lr67jdrAt.name: Sidle-Stab!-Scamper
IWyGR16lr67jdrAt.description: Ogthup takes a Stride action, and at any point during her move can take a Strike action.

xFUgZKC2Kja3BFGn.name: Sneak Attack
xFUgZKC2Kja3BFGn.description: Ogthup deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

XZzJJKcamIQvGqFL.name: Boar Charge
XZzJJKcamIQvGqFL.description: The boar Strides twice and then makes a tusk Strike. As long as it moved at least 20 feet, it gains a +2 circumstance bonus to its attack roll.

9IaAh517Zf7KRU82.name: Spore Burst
9IaAh517Zf7KRU82.description: When an abyssal fungus dies, it triggers its Spore Cloud ability immediately.

KAOz16lrV0kp3Tj4.name: Spore Cloud
KAOz16lrV0kp3Tj4.description:
An abyssal fungus can unleash a cloud of spores that irritates the eyes and throats of non-fungi creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:15]. Each creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:14] save or take @Damage[1d4[persistent,poison]].

A creature has its vision reduced as long as the persistent damage continues and can see only within 20 feet (10 feet on a critical failure).

NkEi7k1U96kl3HD8.name: Spores
NkEi7k1U96kl3HD8.description: A creature that takes damage from an abyssal fungus' ranged spore pod Strike must attempt a saving throw with the same DC and effect as its Spore Cloud ability

vPqK0Xzj05Is8zqq.name: Invigorating Agony
vPqK0Xzj05Is8zqq.description:
Requirements Teflar has spent at least 1 Focus Point

Trigger Teflar takes bleed, piercing, or slashing damage

Effect Teflar regains 1 Focus Point

D2DlGUD9GA5d9gj1.name: Slow
D2DlGUD9GA5d9gj1.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

37XUiSCPpy3SyVwg.name: Searing Aura
37XUiSCPpy3SyVwg.description:
10 feet. The fire-eye zombie emits an aura of heat that causes open wounds to sizzle.

Any living creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the zombie and isn't at full HP must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:19|traits:damaging-effect] save or take @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage as its wounds burn.

Creatures critically hit by the fire-eye zombie's Strikes must attempt this saving throw immediately.

NSrkmgeoEIMlRGQY.name: Eye Throwing
NSrkmgeoEIMlRGQY.description:
A fire-eye zombie can launch its eye at foes. While its eye is out of its head, the fire-eye zombie is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded}.

At the end of its turn, a fire-eye zombie's eye flies back into its eye socket.

3IDgvcfodmDT9Trl.name: Wide Swing
3IDgvcfodmDT9Trl.description: The fire-eye cyclops zombie makes a spiked club Strike and compares the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within the Strike's reach. This attack counts as two attacks for the fire-eye zombie's multiple attack penalty.

uwN4vfr3npnwlu1S.name: Burning Grasp
uwN4vfr3npnwlu1S.description: When the burned-out efreeti Grabs a creature, that creature takes @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage, then takes 1d6 fire damage at the end of each of its turns as long as it remains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

aFBLWbZSpOnYygCn.name: Combat Grab
aFBLWbZSpOnYygCn.description:
Requirements The burned-out efreeti has one hand free

Effect The burned-out efreeti makes a melee Strike while keeping one hand free. If the Strike hits, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in the efreeti's free hand.

JtdcV9EPkv8cTFzY.name: Breath Weapon
JtdcV9EPkv8cTFzY.description:
The mephit swarm breathes energy in a @Template[cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[1d6[acid],1d6[cold],1d6[electricity],1d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic|options:area-effect] save).

The mephit swarm can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

rYtJhqdRrOJV1p7g.name: Swarming Claws
rYtJhqdRrOJV1p7g.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[2d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic] save).

Clouded Quartz (5-6).name: Clouded Quartz (5-6)
Clouded Quartz (5-6).description:
Insatiable scavengers stalking the eternal gloom of the Darklands, cavern trolls consume all in their path-even rocks and minerals when more nourishing sustenance is scarce. These rocky goliaths can tunnel through stone with their iron-sharp claws.

Cavern trolls rarely venture to the surface world, for they have a debilitating vulnerability to sunlight that petrifies them on sustained contact. Unlike common trolls, cavern trolls can regenerate wounds dealt by fire. The crystalline nature of their skin, however, permits sonic attacks to neutralize their signature regeneration.

As cavern trolls age, their flinty skin becomes studded with small crystals and stones of various composition. Paragons of their kind have toothy maws replete with large, crystalline fangs. A typical cavern troll stands 14 feet in height and weighs about 2,000 pounds.

40gYFH2MsCS36FWP.name: Perpetual Storm Aura
40gYFH2MsCS36FWP.description: 10 feet. Clouded Quartz is surrounded by a perpetual storm. The whirling winds impose a -2 circumstance penalty on ranged attack rolls using physical ammunition that target her or originate from her.

FqhlwNyFsYxtpGNp.name: Tempest Sight
FqhlwNyFsYxtpGNp.description: Clouded Quartz can see perfectly through wind and water. She never takes penalties to Perception from wind, rain, fog, or other precipitation, or from looking through water or being underwater, and such conditions don't cause anything to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from her.

tuQ8FrXL4iChAQA1.name: Sunlight Petrification
tuQ8FrXL4iChAQA1.description: If exposed to direct sunlight, Clouded Quartz immediately becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions or Trample. The slowed value increases by 1 each time she ends her turn in sunlight. If Clouded Quartz's actions are reduced to 0 in this way, she becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrified} until she spends at least 1 minute in darkness. Spells like @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.a3aQxCpoj1q1NQxC]{Sunburst} that create magical sunlight cannot petrify Clouded Quartz, but she's slowed 1 for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} after being exposed to such an effect.

BczEX9fZ2q5qXxKI.name: Rock Tunneler
BczEX9fZ2q5qXxKI.description: Clouded Quartz can burrow through solid stone at a Speed of 10 feet. She can leave a tunnel if she desires.

WCbXOYW55njv5jXG.name: Slow
WCbXOYW55njv5jXG.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

WqeQzrDArNCcoIcF.name: Searing Aura
WqeQzrDArNCcoIcF.description:
10 feet. The fire-eye zombie emits an aura of heat that causes open wounds to sizzle.

Any living creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the zombie and isn't at full HP must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:17|traits:damaging-effect] save or take @Damage[1d4[fire]] damage as its wounds burn.

Creatures critically hit by the fire-eye zombie's Strikes must attempt this saving throw immediately.

W6noQhWuklyayC1t.name: Eye Throwing
W6noQhWuklyayC1t.description:
A fire-eye zombie can launch its eye at foes. While its eye is out of its head, the fire-eye zombie is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded}.

At the end of its turn, a fire-eye zombie's eye flies back into its eye socket.

j3ELc14hlrOyqOK9.name: Lead Cloud
j3ELc14hlrOyqOK9.description:
Trigger The leaded skeleton is hit by a melee attack

Effect A cloud of lead dust is released, forming a @Template[burst|distance:5]{5-foot radius} cloud of fine particles surrounding the skeleton. The cloud persists for 1 round, exposing creatures within it to an inhaled form of rapid lead poison.

mTwyXddJq3vxuscO.name: Rapid Lead Poison
mTwyXddJq3vxuscO.description:
High amounts of lead can cause headache, difficulty concentrating, and joint pain. Necromantic magic has augmented the lead that infuses this skeleton, causing it to take effect far more quickly than is typical for lead poisoning.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:18]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage, stupefied 1, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (2 rounds)

qi654bIK2Wel71xJ.name: Recoil from Wasted Opportunities
qi654bIK2Wel71xJ.description: Vermleks cannot stand the sight of a good meal presented and then swiftly taken away. Whenever a dying creature within sight of the vermlek has its dying condition removed, the vermlek takes @Damage[1d6[mental]] damage.

l7iQALiinmCkQCGn.name: Abandon Body
l7iQALiinmCkQCGn.description:
Requirements The vermlek is Inhabiting a Centaur Body

Effect The vermlek crawls out of the body it is inhabiting, devouring much of the body's remaining flesh and regaining 15 Hit Points in the process. The corpse it leaves behind is little more than a husk.

I037b00dCtjP0GRr.name: Inhabit Centaur Body
I037b00dCtjP0GRr.description:
While most vermleks inhabit Medium humanoids, Urxehl has granted this demon the ability to inhabit centaurs instead.

The vermlek crawls into the body of an adjacent dead centaur, consuming the bulk of the victim's skeleton and internal organs as it does so and cramming itself into the cavity.

The vermlek can wield weapons and use the centaur's Speed, hoof attack, and Trample ability. It also gains a +3 circumstance bonus to AC. While Inhabiting a Centaur body, a vermlek can't burrow.

It can't use this ability if it's already Inhabiting a Centaur Body.

eZzf0HOBTpp6YDJa.name: Speed: 40, Burrow: 0 if Inhabiting a Centaur body

E8b36JtwL8igCYrm.name: Unsettling Movement
E8b36JtwL8igCYrm.description:
Whenever the vermlek Abandons a Body or Inhabits a Body, all creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} who can see the vermlek must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:20] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}. On a critical failure, the creature is frightened 1 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Regardless of the result, creatures are immune to the same vermlek's unsettling movement for 24 hours.

eFeUEWJ1TjADrQjO.name: Explode
eFeUEWJ1TjADrQjO.description: When the flaming eye dies, it explodes in a violent burst of flame, dealing @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:14|basic] save) to creatures in a @Template[burst|distance:5].

cMGzubx06UkoCHhs.name: Blightburst
cMGzubx06UkoCHhs.description: When a blighted leaf leshy dies, a burst of rotted compost explodes from its body, dealing @Damage[1d6[slashing],1d6[poison]|options:area-damage]{1d6 slashing damage and 1d6 poison damage} to each creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:30]. This area then fills with blighted saplings, becoming difficult terrain until the saplings wither 24 hours later.

YwSiVQSxOJRFAjSF.name: Change Shape
YwSiVQSxOJRFAjSF.description:
The blighted leaf leshy transforms into a Small gnarled, rotted tree. This ability otherwise uses the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dileJ0Yxqg76LMvu]{One with Plants}.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Kd0WbBjbLnB9LgHa.name: Sickening Blow
Kd0WbBjbLnB9LgHa.description:
When a blighted leaf leshy hits with its seedpod Strike, the target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:17] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

The Scholar of Sorts (1-2).name: The Scholar of Sorts (1-2)
The Scholar of Sorts (1-2).description:
Akizendris gnaw at sources of knowledge and lore, gleefully corrupting and altering them to vex scholars and sages across the planes with contradictions and untruths. These proteans appear as cackling, serpentine creatures with elongated crocodilian faces, luminous eyes, and arms that vanish at the elbows into swirling clouds of runes before reforming into solid talons.

Akizendris amuse themselves by rearranging or deleting texts, placing insulting acrostics in poetic verses, and penning crude insults upon title pages. Libraries in such places as Heaven, Axis, and Hell are especially keen to avoid such contamination, knowing that their records are choice targets for every akizendri in existence.

um06dCu0E8W9LRDd.name: Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 30 feet
um06dCu0E8W9LRDd.description: An akizendri can anticipate the most likely location of a creature through their supernatural insight into the forces of chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants the Scholar the ability to sense creatures within the listed range. A creature under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Veil of Privacy} or that is otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions cannot be noticed via entropy sense.

3WqEPpUcLFd5pJv6.name: Protean Anatomy 6
3WqEPpUcLFd5pJv6.description:
An akizendri's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the Scholar takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first.

The Scholar is immune to polymorph effects unless they are a willing target. If @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, the Scholar automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.

tH3f4GsDerHRNPik.name: Change Shape
tH3f4GsDerHRNPik.description:
The Scholar takes on the appearance of any Small or smaller creature. This doesn't change its Speed or its attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes, but might change the damage type its Strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

rB0kJuC158tvKsmj.name: Garbled Thoughts
rB0kJuC158tvKsmj.description:
A creature hit by the Scholar's bite Strike must attempt a @Check[will|dc:20] save.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round.

nIDe1OaPgWDPyBej.name: Text Immersion
nIDe1OaPgWDPyBej.description:
When the Scholar casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VVAZPCvd4d90qVA1]{Secret Page}, it can physically immerse itself in the text, changing the message of the text in the process. It can exit the book at any point by Dismissing secret page, at which point it appears in a space adjacent to the text. If it does so to begin combat, it rolls a Deception check for initiative.

As long as it remains immersed in the text, the Scholar has no body. It can communicate telepathically with a creature as long as the creature touches the book or scroll that contains the secret page. It can sense nearby creatures using its entropy sense, but not in any other way, nor can it use any attack, manipulate, or move actions or speak aloud. If the object they are immersed in is destroyed, the Scholar reappears in an adjacent square and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

OJm7rYI5Ruon3nTT.name: Text Passage
OJm7rYI5Ruon3nTT.description:
Requirements The Scholar is adjacent to a text they have modified with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VVAZPCvd4d90qVA1]{Secret Page}, and another such text is within 500 feet

Effect The Scholar has a way with words beyond other akizendris. They physically immerse themself into the adjacent text, which they use as a medium to teleport to another text within 500 feet that they have modified with secret page. Once they enter the first text, they instantly know the locations of the other texts within range.

Entering a text in this manner automatically dispels the secret page effect on it, but not the secret page effect on the destination text. The locations of the Scholar's modified texts are marked on the map.

Vkr5JP0wtxXI2JJO.name: Eluding Strike
Vkr5JP0wtxXI2JJO.description:
Trigger A creature targets Archis with a melee attack and Archis can see the attacker

Effect Archis dodges out of the way, gaining a +1 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the attack misses, Archis makes a melee Strike against that creature.

This Strike doesn't count toward Archis' multiple attack penalty, and his multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

XwdMGdme828bOsAC.name: Sneak Attack
XwdMGdme828bOsAC.description: Archis Peers deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

R5zztXABMO2mtYBr.name: Sonic Redirection
R5zztXABMO2mtYBr.description:
Trigger The spark troll would take sonic damage

Effect The spark troll redirects hazardous sonic vibrations to another target within 30 feet. The spark troll gains resistance 5 against the triggering damage, and their chosen target must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:16] save or be knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

EOzNUSuV9na9Exal.name: Lightning Blast
EOzNUSuV9na9Exal.description: The spark troll calls lightning down from the sky, then redirects it out from their hands in a @Template[line|distance:40]. Creatures in the line take @Damage[1d4[electricity]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:16|basic] save).

uMgiz8SqmSdQdVjr.name: Hunt Prey
uMgiz8SqmSdQdVjr.description: The Scorched Earth scout designates a single creature they can see and hear, or one they're Tracking, as their prey. The Scorched Earth scout gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} the prey and to Survival checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Track} the prey. The first time the Scorched Earth scout hits the designated prey in a round, they deal an additional 1d8 precision damage. The Scorched Earth scout also ignores the penalty for making ranged attacks within their second range increment. These effects last until the Scorched Earth scout uses Hunt Prey again.

I7TPiY7nSjh8NCvV.name: Wishbound Vision
I7TPiY7nSjh8NCvV.description: The belker is accustomed to working together with the mist stalkers and ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from both smoke and mist.

hDgRV0F4vLYv4H9C.name: Smoke Form
hDgRV0F4vLYv4H9C.description: The belker can occupy the same space as other creatures.

Ebi8GNY5UeM9WeJ5.name: Noxious Fumes
Ebi8GNY5UeM9WeJ5.description:
Requirements The belker is occupying the same space as a Medium or smaller creature

Effect The belker attempts to flow into the creature's lungs; the creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:24] save. On a failure, the creature partially inhales the belker and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} by the pain of the smoke rasping in its throat and lungs. The creature can attempt to exhale the belker by spending an action coughing and succeeding at a @Check[fortitude|dc:24] save.

Most of the belker remains outside the creature, so the belker can still act normally. If the belker moves out of the creature's space or uses again, the creature automatically exhales it.

TbwDJPCnJc8ncoVB.name: Smoke Slash
TbwDJPCnJc8ncoVB.description:
Requirements The belker is partially inhaled by a creature

Effect The belker automatically deals its claw damage to the inhaling creature by forming a claw to slash and scrape the creature from within.

AAot6LC81mrQcnMK.name: Infused Items
AAot6LC81mrQcnMK.description: Strak carries the following infused items, which last for 24 hours, or until the next time he makes his daily preparations: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.TZUskLT7yvP7N2co]{Elixir of Life (Lesser)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.SgtqZxt26BdjUmEB]{Acid Flask (Moderate)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.gWr4q4HiyGhETA8H]{Alchemist's Fire (Moderate)} (9), and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ehss8yPTXxiUdVlJ]{Smokestick (Greater)}.

v2jomqrygPJLCRjt.name: Quick Bomber
v2jomqrygPJLCRjt.description: Strak draws an alchemical bomb with an Interact action and throws it as a ranged Strike.

UTQLyZ7H8eYOM5p5.name: Blood Scent 1 mile
UTQLyZ7H8eYOM5p5.description: The shark can smell blood in the water from up to 1 mile away.

69MZMQoPzOTaa0gd.name: Breach
69MZMQoPzOTaa0gd.description: The shark Swims up to its swim Speed, then Leaps vertically out of the water up to 15 feet high, making a Strike against a creature at any point during the jump (this lets it attack a creature within 20 feet of the water's surface). After the Strike, the shark splashes back down into the water.

0RFa0KfekeJrXX6w.name: Masked Intentions
0RFa0KfekeJrXX6w.description: 30 feet. Kareida's mask hides her focus in a fight. Enemies that start their turn in the aura or enter it must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:16|name:Masked Focus] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to Kareida and take a -2 circumstance penalty to saving throw DCs against skill checks Kareida makes against them until the start of their next turn. On a critical success, the foe is temporarily immune for 1 minute. If Kareida is not wearing her scarecrow mask, she loses this ability.

Lion (PFS 2-13).name: Lion (PFS 2-13)
Lion (PFS 2-13).description:
Lions are cooperative hunters, ambushing dangerous prey in groups of lionesses that work in tandem to trap and kill their prey. Male lions are typically larger, with long manes, and when they hunt, they tend to do so on their own.

Few predators of the natural world can match the cat's talent for stalking and stealth.

hYcrjabm50sPyqBV.name: Pack Attack
hYcrjabm50sPyqBV.description: The lion deals 1d4 extra damage to any creature that's within reach of at least two of the lion's allies.

LxnGNDFd9yCEkOAt.name: Pounce
LxnGNDFd9yCEkOAt.description: The lion Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the lion began this action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, it remains hidden until after this ability's Strike.

387c1CSiNx4uWeqZ.name: Sneak Attack
387c1CSiNx4uWeqZ.description: The lion deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

4IwBDQDDuT9baOlo.name: Maiden's Mending
4IwBDQDDuT9baOlo.description:
Frequency once per minute

Trigger Mother Forsythe casts a non-cantrip occult spell

Effect Mother Forsythe gains 3 temporary Hit Points that last until the end of her next turn.

d4Zq9o3SvCZDifiP.name: Mist Child
d4Zq9o3SvCZDifiP.description: Mother Forsythe blends in with unnatural subtlety. When she is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, the DC of the flat check to target her is increased to 6 if she's concealed or 12 if she's hidden.

EsRnesFOS55v5HAE.name: Sneak Attack
EsRnesFOS55v5HAE.description: Mother Forsythe deals 2d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Ember Fox (PFS 2-14).name: Ember Fox (PFS 2-14)
Ember Fox (PFS 2-14).description: Ember foxes resemble their canid namesakes, save for the flames that make their fur and the tips of their long whiskers flicker and glow.

JlQUb1sbsYfmz5Vi.name: Cloak in Embers
JlQUb1sbsYfmz5Vi.description:
Trigger An adjacent ally is targeted by an effect that deals fire damage

Effect The ember fox drapes itself across its ally, granting the ally fire resistance 10 against the incoming attack.

MxwlTxikfGXnrlr3.name: Winter Wise
MxwlTxikfGXnrlr3.description: Chesjilawa can see normally through mist, fog, and all forms of precipitation. She ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition caused by such effects. She ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain from snow and ice and doesn't risk falling when crossing such terrain.

SEeNrV1YVscRiAEM.name: Mirrorshard Spell
SEeNrV1YVscRiAEM.description: A mirror of ice forms around Chesjilawa's hand or wand as she focuses her magic into a more physical form, the better to damage creatures who can resist the cold. If her next action is to Cast a Spell that deals cold damage, the mirror shatters into a blitz of ice shards, changing half of the spell's damage from cold to slashing.

2sPPytpDwbbGGzJk.name: Snow Step
2sPPytpDwbbGGzJk.description:
Icy flowers bloom around Chesjilawa as she instantly transports herself in a flurry of snow to a space within 120 feet that she can see. The destination must contain ice or snow.

She then can't Snow Step for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

y8IC6e06XDyDXrHZ.name: Davai!
y8IC6e06XDyDXrHZ.description:
Semyon orders his troops to fire, selecting a single target he can see. All allies that can hear or see him gain a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls against that creature until the beginning of Semyon's next turn. (Note: The Guiding Words effect provides this bonus)

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.uqjx1bwYduHwwC7d]{Effect: Davai!}

bL1JPt8DZvH1Q0ud.name: Gunpowder Mastery
bL1JPt8DZvH1Q0ud.description: With their rifles' firing ability ruined beyond repair, the soldiers put their gunpowder reserves to use, making explosive arrows and rigging their guns to let off sparks on each successful bayonet Strike. On a critical hit with the bayonet, the target catches fire, taking @Damage[2d4[persistent,fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:24|traits:damaging-effect] negates).

6nuu26T3Jm5SkAtW.name: Trench Fighter
6nuu26T3Jm5SkAtW.description: The Russian soldiers have trained extensively to make good use of cover. They receive a +5 circumstance bonus to AC from greater cover and a +3 circumstance bonus from standard cover, rather than +4 and +2, respectively

Famished Mimic.name: Famished Mimic
Famished Mimic.description:
Thought to be the result of a failed experiment meant to animate objects or a sinister alghollthu creation, mimics are clever monsters that can take the form of common manufactured objects. Mimics are ambush predators and voracious eaters, surprising their prey through their uncanny ability to mimic the form of common furniture and miscellany. They remain disguised until unsuspecting adventurers happen by, then they lash out in ambush.

Mimics possess complex alien minds, and while often cruel and self-serving, they also enjoy conversation with their prey from time to time. For unknown reasons, they are especially interested in humanoids. Mimics have a strong dislike for others of their kind and tend to live alone. A mimic can remain in its alternate form for an extremely long period of time, sometimes remaining disguised in a dungeon chamber for decades. Regardless of how long it waits, the mimic remains vigilant and alert, ready to strike at any moment.

91iOrkVbzeP7cK2M.name: Adhesive
91iOrkVbzeP7cK2M.description:
The mimic is coated in an adhesive slime. Any creature that hits the mimic, is hit by the mimic, or otherwise touches the mimic must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:21] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} (Escape DC 21). A weapon that hits the mimic is stuck to the mimic and can be removed with a successful @Check[athletics|dc:23] check (made as a single action).

A mimic can have any number of objects or creatures stuck to it at a time. The mimic can release a stuck creature or object by using a single action, and the adhesive dissolves 1 minute after the mimic dies, releasing all stuck objects and creatures.

Ns2pok7e6UtuKUd6.name: Object Lesson
Ns2pok7e6UtuKUd6.description:
Trigger A creature touches or physically interacts with the mimic while the mimic is transformed using Mimic Object.

Effect The triggering creature is automatically stuck by the mimic's adhesive (it receives no save). The mimic then makes a pseudopod Strike against any creature adjacent to the mimic.

Object Lesson can't be used again until the mimic escapes and takes on a new disguise.

M3QwWIU2rzRHWndo.name: Mimic Object
M3QwWIU2rzRHWndo.description: The mimic assumes the shape of any Medium object. This doesn't change the mimic's texture or overall size but can alter its coloration and visual appearance. It has an automatic result of 26 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as the object that it's mimicking.

a3d0hy3dj9u9pntm.name: Boiling Blood
a3d0hy3dj9u9pntm.description: Each time an adjacent creature deals slashing or piercing damage to the brimorak, the attacker is sprayed with the brimorak's boiling blood, which deals @Damage[3d4[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save).

fzrpqq4mvr4g5s36.name: Extinguishing Aversion
fzrpqq4mvr4g5s36.description: Dousing a brimorak with water, either ordinary water or from a water effect, causes no physical harm to the fiend but deals @Damage[3d6[mental]] damage. Fully immersing the brimorak in water deals @Damage[5d6[mental]] damage per round.

7ullxbvs8wpmjlzq.name: Smoke Vision
7ullxbvs8wpmjlzq.description: Smoke doesn't impair a brimorak's vision; they ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

ornom9b33sn8mps5.name: Breath Weapon
ornom9b33sn8mps5.description:
The brimorak spits their boiling blood in a @Template[line|distance:20] that deals @Damage[8d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic|options:area-effect] save).

The brimorak can't use their Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

The ground within this area becomes slippery, with the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Wu0xFpewMKRK3HG8]{Grease} spell targeting an area until it's cleaned up or the brimorak is able to use their Breath Weapon again, whichever comes first.

3g2l9ydocvf28khl.name: Flaming Weapon
3g2l9ydocvf28khl.description: A brimorak's hooves and any weapon they wield burst into flame, dealing an extra @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage with each hit. If they don't have a weapon, they can create a flaming sword of fire and steel (see flaming sword Strike in Melee entry above).

c52mxlmgfax2xrkf.name: Fume
c52mxlmgfax2xrkf.description: The brimorak emits a cloud of thick black smoke in a @Template[burst|distance:10]{10-foot burst} that remains in place for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. All creatures within the smoke become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and all creatures outside the smoke become concealed to creatures within it. A creature that enters or begins its turn within the smoke it must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:24] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

eu9kMN9JNocn50Zw.name: Guardian Construct Armor (Hardness 6)
eu9kMN9JNocn50Zw.description:
Like normal objects, the animated guardian has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness.

Once the animated guardian is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 15. It also loses its hardness.

XbTD7oBK1dYTt4M9.name: Death Frenzy
XbTD7oBK1dYTt4M9.description:
Trigger The Usij acolyte is reduced to 0 Hit Points, and the acolyte can see or hear a div within 60 feet

Effect The Usij Acolyte makes a melee Strike before dying.

M3na0AbE4UOQCZSq.name: Construct Armor (Hardness 3)
M3na0AbE4UOQCZSq.description:
Like normal objects, the anatomical model has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage the model takes by an amount equal to the Hardness.

Once an anatomical model is reduced to fewer than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks, removing the Hardness and reducing its Armor Class to 13.

RVJNNG5muHCPqqnR.name: Slimy Guts
RVJNNG5muHCPqqnR.description: A creature hit by the anatomical model's guts attack is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until it takes an action to remove the guts. A creature critically hit by the anatomical model's guts attack is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes}.

H8Pw5Epmiku1SXS8.name: Spore Burst
H8Pw5Epmiku1SXS8.description: When an abyssal fungus dies, it triggers its Spore Cloud ability immediately.

wA0lsQyYycyOxlSZ.name: Spore Cloud
wA0lsQyYycyOxlSZ.description: An abyssal fungus can unleash a cloud of spores that irritates the eyes and throats of non-fungus creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:15]. Each creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:12|traits:damaging-effect] save or take @Damage[1d4[persistent,poison]]. A creature has its vision reduced as long as the persistent damage continues and can see only within 20 feet (10 feet on a critical failure).

HOiDyDPvG3k5u1yf.name: Spores
HOiDyDPvG3k5u1yf.description: A creature that takes damage from an abyssal fungus' ranged spore pod Strike must attempt a saving throw with the same DC and effect as its Spore Cloud ability.

pSImYUf3A2PIf7WF.name: Formation
pSImYUf3A2PIf7WF.description: When Morgroar is adjacent to at least two other allies, he gains a +1 circumstance bonus to AC and saving throws. This bonus increases to +2 to Reflex saves against area effects.

u7gUhf1qhUisat9Z.name: General's Cry
u7gUhf1qhUisat9Z.description: When a hobgoblin general rolls initiative, as long as they can perceive at least one foe, they can yell a mighty battle cry. The hobgoblin general attempts an Intimidate check to [[/act demoralize]] a single foe within 60 feet as a free action. If successful, any ally with the goblin trait can, as its first action on its first turn of the combat, Stride up to double its speed as a single action.

iZHfM2qjLHZnanIe.name: Polearm Critical Specialization
iZHfM2qjLHZnanIe.description: On a critical hit, the target of the critical hit is moved 5 feet in a direction of Morgroar's choice.

76YxXswLlRhaNr9h.name: Formation
76YxXswLlRhaNr9h.description: When Morgroar is adjacent to at least two other allies, he gains a +1 circumstance bonus to AC and saving throws. This bonus increases to +2 to Reflex saves against area effects.

2Ma8eZm11bHpL8dj.name: General's Cry
2Ma8eZm11bHpL8dj.description: When a hobgoblin general rolls initiative, as long as they can perceive at least one foe, they can yell a mighty battle cry. The hobgoblin general attempts an Intimidate check to [[/act demoralize]] a single foe within 60 feet as a free action. If successful, any ally with the goblin trait can, as its first action on its first turn of the combat, Stride up to double its speed as a single action.

pcRBRAKxocKj0P60.name: Polearm Critical Specialization
pcRBRAKxocKj0P60.description: On a critical hit, the target of the critical hit is moved 5 feet in a direction of Morgroar's choice.

Yeth Warbeast.name: Yeth Warbeast
Yeth Warbeast.description:
Wicked canine creatures who live for the thrill of the hunt, yeth hounds often serve evil masters as guardians and trackers. Yeth hounds resemble lean, sleek dogs with overlarge ears and narrow paws that can tread on air as easily as the ground. Despite their canine appearance, yeth hounds are remarkably intelligent, although they rarely display this intelligence except when devising intricate tactics to ensnare their quarry. Their eerie bays echo across the countryside when they are engaged in a hunt, and they particularly enjoy baying to frighten and disorient intelligent creatures. Yeth hound packs can number as many as a dozen members, each working in uncanny communion with its packmates to corner and kill their prey. Yeth hounds like to drag their victims back to their lairs to eat at their leisure, so these lairs often contain discarded treasures from the hounds' previous meals.

Yeth hounds despise two things: sunlight and other canines. They hunt only at night if they can, often breaking off their hunt at dawn to retreat to a subterranean lair or den, no matter how close they had come to catching their prey. Yeth hounds usually attack wargs, wolves, and similar creatures on sight, working to drive larger or more powerful canines from their hunting areas when then can't simply overpower and kill them.

Evil rangers, bestial demons, and wicked cults are frequently gifted yeth hound servants by fiendish patrons. Such hounds often serve as spies and are quick to turn against those who fail to advance the patrons' wicked aims. The cult of Lamashtu, in particular, is fond of using yeth hounds as temple guardians.

uNH8ZKqCgsh6qYis.name: Bay
uNH8ZKqCgsh6qYis.description:
The yeth warbeast emits an unearthly howl audible up to @Template[emanation|distance:300]{300 feet} feet away. Any non-fiend creature that hears the howl must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:25] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}. Any creature that critically fails and is within @Template[emanation|distance:60]{60 feet} of the yeth warbeast is instead @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} (or until it recovers from its frightened condition).

Whether it succeeds or fails the saving throw, the creature is then temporarily immune to Bay for 24 hours.

61RVKGlbgCVFbVf1.name: Ear-splitting Howl
61RVKGlbgCVFbVf1.description:
The yeth warbeast releases a piercing bark that deals @Damage[8d6[sonic]] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:20] (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic] save). A creature that critically fails also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}, or increases the value of its frightened condition by 1 if already frightened.

The warbeast can't use Ear-Splitting Howl again for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

MgWi09fDy6GgzHJM.name: Sinister Bite
MgWi09fDy6GgzHJM.description: A good creature bitten by a yeth hound must attempt a @Check[will|dc:25] save. On a critical success, the creature is temporarily immune to sinister bite for 1 minute. A creature that fails becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}, or increases the value of its frightened condition by 1 if already frightened.

Fence (PFS 2-00).name: Fence (PFS 2-00)
Fence (PFS 2-00).description:
The longer criminals hold on to stolen loot, the greater the chance they will get caught. Fences make themselves indispensable in the underworld by paying for stolen goods in order to resell them later, whether through a seemingly legitimate business or to a closed group of elite buyers.

Some criminals are the desperate who have no option but to break the law to survive, while others choose a life of crime for thrills, forming gangs or underworld guilds that specialize in certain illegal ventures.

blPj44XSQdjiu1MS.name: Fence's Eye
blPj44XSQdjiu1MS.description: Fences live by their ability to recognize a viable trade. They can use Underworld Lore to identify an item's value and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.eReSHVEPCsdkSL4G]{Identify Magic} on an item. They gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Underworld Lore checks when doing so, and to Underworld Lore checks to determine whether an item was stolen, whether a stolen item would be too recognizable to easily move, and who would be interested in purchasing such an item.

cMz56RGF3H0a0ZQi.name: Quick Rummage
cMz56RGF3H0a0ZQi.description: The fence always has a few items close at hand. The fence @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pvQ5rY2zrtPI614F]{Interacts} to draw a weapon or item that takes a single action to activate, and then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VjxZFuUXrCU94MWR]{Strikes} with the weapon or activates the item.

0WoLHxcEDfHig6LB.name: Scoundrel's Feint
0WoLHxcEDfHig6LB.description: When the fence successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feints}, their target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the fence's attacks until the end of the fence's next turn. On a critical success, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against all attacks until the end of the fence's next turn.

ttSdjINAYV0VxPZk.name: Sneak Attack
ttSdjINAYV0VxPZk.description: The fence deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

9Sddw4NHUW8dEcII.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

ZKEB9TXW3zTrnq2F.name: Urxehl's Grace
ZKEB9TXW3zTrnq2F.description:
Trigger Urxehl's firestorm targets a creature

Effect The Disciple of Urxehl redirects the firestorm, causing it to target a different creature of the Disciple's choice.

3Y0DD3yigmZsYOwO.name: Channel Firestorm
3Y0DD3yigmZsYOwO.description: If the next action the Disciple of Urxehl takes is to Cast a Spell, any creature that has taken damage from Urxehl's firestorm since the Disciple's last turn takes a -2 circumstance penalty to AC and saves against the spell.

MwXTBFWH78hOkqqZ.name: Trapped Prey
MwXTBFWH78hOkqqZ.description: The mercenary trapper's attacks deal an extra 1d6 precision damage to creatures that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} by a mechanical jaws trap.

uwN4vfr3npnwlu1S.name: Burning Grasp
uwN4vfr3npnwlu1S.description: When the burned-out efreeti Grabs a creature, that creature takes @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage, then takes 1d6 fire damage at the end of each of its turns as long as it remains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

aFBLWbZSpOnYygCn.name: Combat Grab
aFBLWbZSpOnYygCn.description:
Requirements The burned-out efreeti has one hand free

Effect The burned-out efreeti makes a melee Strike while keeping one hand free. If the Strike hits, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in the efreeti's free hand.

Ez6yZnRjFLYMw2uU.name: Shell Block
Ez6yZnRjFLYMw2uU.description:
Trigger A creature adjacent to the dragon turtle targets it with a melee attack.

Effect The dragon turtle rolls its shell toward the triggering creature, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to its AC against the triggering attack.

SxzPmzzRILX0GL4D.name: Breath Weapon
SxzPmzzRILX0GL4D.description:
The dragon turtle breathes a massive blast of steam that deals @Damage[8d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to creatures within a @Template[cone|distance:40] (@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic|options:area-effect] save). This steam blast affects creatures within the water, as well as outside.

The dragon turtle can't use its Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

ayKccHg7VU6CvDA0.name: Capsize
ayKccHg7VU6CvDA0.description: The dragon turtle tries to capsize an adjacent aquatic vessel of its size or smaller. The dragon turtle must succeed at an Athletics check with a DC of 27 or the pilot's Sailing Lore DC, whichever is higher.

qJyDVXrr1oJKVjFF.name: Draconic Frenzy
qJyDVXrr1oJKVjFF.description: The dragon turtle makes two claw Strikes and one jaws Strike in any order.

Q9zBEJadYek4byhL.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Vitality

u0qtiehbawh9zc6i.name: Vengeful Flash
u0qtiehbawh9zc6i.description:
Trigger A creature makes a successful melee attack against the spirit or makes a successful Acrobatics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.21WIfSu7Xd7uKqV8]{Tumble Through} the spirit's space

Effect The spirit emits a brief pulse of void energy that deals @Damage[5d6[void]] damage to the triggering creature (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic] save).

deohz0twkhfh85sb.name: Abyssal Spite
deohz0twkhfh85sb.description: The spirit lashes out at a creature within 60 feet, dealing @Damage[(2d10+7)[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:28|basic] save).

zazvlexa126sfvu3.name: Drain Life
zazvlexa126sfvu3.description: When the demoniac spirit damages a living creature with its spectral claw Strike, the spirit gains 10 temporary Hit Points and the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:28] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. Further damage dealt by the spirit increases the drained condition value by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of drained 4.

izo7ei7hmq9d8ljk.name: Ritual Transformation
izo7ei7hmq9d8ljk.description: The spirit has been absorbing energy through the ritual so it can transform itself once Urxehl manifests. Once the total value of all of the drained conditions the spirit has inflicted with drain life reaches 3, it loses its incorporeal trait as its body becomes solid. The spirit loses all of its immunities and resistances, it gains 40 Temporary Hit Points, and its Strength bonus increases to +0.

32sJ45kKGClodunO.name: Smoldering Stench
32sJ45kKGClodunO.description:
5 feet. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:17] save.

Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to for 1 minute.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

7H6APZVumPTqn9CK.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Vitality

9o2s7aspf4e8m9ue.name: Vengeful Flash
9o2s7aspf4e8m9ue.description:
Trigger A creature makes a successful melee attack against the spirit or makes a successful Acrobatics check to Tumble Through the spirit's space

Effect The spirit emits a brief pulse of void energy that deals @Damage[5d6[void]] damage to the triggering creature (@Check[reflex|dc:28|basic] save).

wbfdtdnqgg8vspks.name: Abyssal Spite
wbfdtdnqgg8vspks.description: The spirit lashes out at a creature within 60 feet, dealing @Damage[(2d12+8)[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:30|basic] save).

c87n4u0cndk6ckmm.name: Drain Life
c87n4u0cndk6ckmm.description: When the demoniac spirit damages a living creature with its spectral claw Strike, the spirit gains 10 temporary Hit Points and the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:30] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. Further damage dealt by the spirit increases the drained condition value by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of drained 4.

jFofYzlVMR2wgqmU.name: Ritual Transformation
jFofYzlVMR2wgqmU.description: The spirit has been absorbing energy through the ritual so it can transform itself once Urxehl manifests. Once the total value of all of the drained conditions the spirit has inflicted with drain life reaches 3, it loses its incorporeal trait as its body becomes solid. The spirit loses all of its immunities and resistances, it gains 40 Temporary Hit Points, and its Strength bonus increases to +0.

Weak Lion.name: Weak Lion
Weak Lion.description:
Lions are cooperative hunters, ambushing dangerous prey in groups of lionesses that work in tandem to trap and kill their prey. Male lions are typically larger, with long manes, and when they hunt, they tend to do so on their own.

Few predators of the natural world can match the cat's talent for stalking and stealth.

hYcrjabm50sPyqBV.name: Pack Attack
hYcrjabm50sPyqBV.description: The lion deals 1d4 extra damage to any creature that's within reach of at least two of the lion's allies.

LxnGNDFd9yCEkOAt.name: Pounce
LxnGNDFd9yCEkOAt.description: The lion Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the lion began this action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, it remains hidden until after this ability's Strike.

387c1CSiNx4uWeqZ.name: Sneak Attack
387c1CSiNx4uWeqZ.description: The lion deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

x3UFyZwCCZPJ4YMT.name: The Sea's Revenge
x3UFyZwCCZPJ4YMT.description: A creature that slays a draugr is subjected to a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.z2mfh3oPnfYqXflY]{Mariner's Curse} spell with a save DC of 20. The curse ends if the draugr is buried in a calm sea or after 1 week passes.

Z7jlJMUOEYWNRyEf.name: Grotesque Gift
Z7jlJMUOEYWNRyEf.description: A draugr's attacks spatter their targets with rancid flesh and rotting seaweed. A creature damaged by a draugr's Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

uKVy7brV5DJqD14v.name: Swipe
uKVy7brV5DJqD14v.description: The draugr makes a melee Strike and compares the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within its melee reach and adjacent to each other. Roll damage only once and apply it to each creature hit. A counts as two attacks for the draugr's multiple attack penalty.

blnlbHg4zm5aPODb.name: Dissociate
blnlbHg4zm5aPODb.description:
Trigger The wind malevolent would be hit by an effect that deals bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage

Effect The wind malevolent dissociates into component elemental wisps while vaguely retaining its weasel-like form. This grants it bludgeoning resistance 5, piercing resistance 5, slashing resistance 5, weakness 5 to area damage, and weakness 5 to splash damage. While in this dissociated form, it can't use its vacuum sickle Strike. The wind malevolent automatically re-forms into its normal form at the beginning of its next turn.

zZhXDr0O3nKNwMa4.name: Broad Swipe
zZhXDr0O3nKNwMa4.description: The skeleton makes two Strikes with its bo staff against two adjacent foes, both of whom are within its reach. The multiple attack penalty does not increase until after both attacks are resolved.

ywp4JyHQAVo3iLhj.name: Explosive Death
ywp4JyHQAVo3iLhj.description: When the skeleton is destroyed, its bones shatter and explode as the necromantic energy holding it together is released. Adjacent creatures take @Damage[1d6[slashing]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:15|basic] save

IJWwhJN9hAWZSUST.name: Terrifying Charge
IJWwhJN9hAWZSUST.description: The skeleton Strides and makes a claw Strike with a +2 circumstance bonus to damage circumstance bonus to damage. If the strike hits, the skeleton attempts to [[/act demoralize]] the target.

Clouded Quartz (7-8).name: Clouded Quartz (7-8)
Clouded Quartz (7-8).description:
Insatiable scavengers stalking the eternal gloom of the Darklands, cavern trolls consume all in their path-even rocks and minerals when more nourishing sustenance is scarce. These rocky goliaths can tunnel through stone with their iron-sharp claws.

Cavern trolls rarely venture to the surface world, for they have a debilitating vulnerability to sunlight that petrifies them on sustained contact. Unlike common trolls, cavern trolls can regenerate wounds dealt by fire. The crystalline nature of their skin, however, permits sonic attacks to neutralize their signature regeneration.

As cavern trolls age, their flinty skin becomes studded with small crystals and stones of various composition. Paragons of their kind have toothy maws replete with large, crystalline fangs. A typical cavern troll stands 14 feet in height and weighs about 2,000 pounds.

40gYFH2MsCS36FWP.name: Perpetual Storm Aura
40gYFH2MsCS36FWP.description: 10 feet. Clouded Quartz is surrounded by a perpetual storm. The whirling winds impose a -2 circumstance penalty on ranged attack rolls using physical ammunition that target her or originate from her.

FqhlwNyFsYxtpGNp.name: Tempest Sight
FqhlwNyFsYxtpGNp.description: Clouded Quartz can see perfectly through wind and water. She never takes penalties to Perception from wind, rain, fog, or other precipitation, or from looking through water or being underwater, and such conditions don't cause anything to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from her.

tuQ8FrXL4iChAQA1.name: Sunlight Petrification
tuQ8FrXL4iChAQA1.description: If exposed to direct sunlight, Clouded Quartz immediately becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions or Trample. The slowed value increases by 1 each time she ends her turn in sunlight. If Clouded Quartz's actions are reduced to 0 in this way, she becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrified} until she spends at least 1 minute in darkness. Spells like @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.a3aQxCpoj1q1NQxC]{Sunburst} that create magical sunlight cannot petrify Clouded Quartz, but she is slowed 1 for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} after being exposed to such an effect.

BczEX9fZ2q5qXxKI.name: Rock Tunneler
BczEX9fZ2q5qXxKI.description: Clouded Quartz can burrow through solid stone at a Speed of 10 feet. She can leave a tunnel if she desires.

R8ajLDqmU0HyK0q7.name: Pus Burst
R8ajLDqmU0HyK0q7.description:
Trigger The giant crawling hand takes piercing or slashing damage

Effect A random creature adjacent to the giant crawling hand is sprayed with vile pus that deals @Damage[2d6[void]] damage. The affected creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:19|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes half damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature takes full damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3}.

ImEauJvx5theWLHA.name: Mark Quarry
ImEauJvx5theWLHA.description: A crawling hand can be assigned a quarry by anointing the hand with a drop of the intended quarry's blood. If the hand ever has no quarry, it automatically gains the next creature it damages as its quarry. The hand gains a +1 circumstance bonus to Perception checks when it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seeks} its quarry, to Survival checks when it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Tracks} its quarry, and damage rolls when it Strikes its quarry.

Plague Zombie (PFS 2-15).name: Plague Zombie (PFS 2-15)
Plague Zombie (PFS 2-15).description:
Plague zombies are infested with hideous contagions.

A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed.

a2pZeef5wn9y5xAA.name: Slow
a2pZeef5wn9y5xAA.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

RhGXKyPEo0bWS5D1.name: Zombie Rot
RhGXKyPEo0bWS5D1.description:
An infected creature can't heal damage it takes from zombie rot until it has been cured of the disease.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:18]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[void]] damage (1 day)

Stage 3 1d6 void damage (1 day)

Stage 4 1d6 void damage (1 day)

Stage 5 dead, rising as a plague zombie immediately

Scorched Cavern Troll.name: Scorched Cavern Troll
Scorched Cavern Troll.description:
Insatiable scavengers stalking the eternal gloom of the Darklands, cavern trolls consume all in their path-even rocks and minerals when more nourishing sustenance is scarce. These rocky goliaths can tunnel through stone with their iron-sharp claws.

Cavern trolls rarely venture to the surface world, for they have a debilitating vulnerability to sunlight that petrifies them on sustained contact. Unlike common trolls, cavern trolls can regenerate wounds dealt by fire. The crystalline nature of their skin, however, permits sonic attacks to neutralize their signature regeneration.

As cavern trolls age, their flinty skin becomes studded with small crystals and stones of various composition. Paragons of their kind have toothy maws replete with large, crystalline fangs. A typical cavern troll stands 14 feet in height and weighs about 2,000 pounds.

82mYFvhHNCVY8VhZ.name: Sunlight Petrification
82mYFvhHNCVY8VhZ.description: If exposed to direct sunlight, a cavern troll immediately becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions or Trample. The slowed value increases by 1 each time the cavern troll ends its turn in sunlight. If the cavern troll's actions are reduced to 0 in this way, they become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrified} until they spends at least 1 minute in darkness. Spells like @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.a3aQxCpoj1q1NQxC]{Sunburst} that create magical sunlight cannot petrify a cavern troll, but the troll is slowed 1 for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} after being exposed to such an effect.

Wuf9DlYpWzZIh7S0.name: Rock Tunneler
Wuf9DlYpWzZIh7S0.description: A cavern troll can burrow through solid stone at a Speed of 10 feet. It can leave a tunnel if it desires.

HTIrnZpmVBuj0HWR.name: Blightburst
HTIrnZpmVBuj0HWR.description: When a blighted fungus leshy dies, a burst of rotted compost explodes from its body, dealing @Damage[3d6[slashing],1d6[poison]|options:area-damage]{3d6 slashing damage and 1d6 poison damage} to each creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:30]. This area then fills with blighted fungi, becoming difficult terrain until the fungi wither 24 hours later.

K99lsPqYrIksz3FZ.name: Change Shape
K99lsPqYrIksz3FZ.description:
The blighted fungus leshy transforms into a Small, sickly-looking giant mushroom or patch of fungi. This ability otherwise uses the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dileJ0Yxqg76LMvu]{One with Plants}.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

dKyKONN7fxhtL3JY.name: Spore Cloud
dKyKONN7fxhtL3JY.description: A blighted fungus leshy can unleash a cloud of spores that irritates the eyes and throats of non-fungi creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:15]. Each creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save or take @Damage[2[persistent,poison]] damage. On a failure, a creature has its vision range reduced to 20 feet (10 feet on a critical failure) as long as the persistent damage continues.

Oid3aElVxaYtEI0E.name: Spores
Oid3aElVxaYtEI0E.description: A creature damaged by a blighted fungus leshy's spore pod Strike must attempt a saving throw with the same DC and effect as its Spore Cloud ability.

MsT6TGVjxiwPwsWa.name: Crumble
MsT6TGVjxiwPwsWa.description:
Trigger The ash skeleton is critically hit

Effect The ash skeleton crumbles to ash, and the attack deals only normal damage

H1wtoiRQ0sMn9hmN.name: Ash Form
H1wtoiRQ0sMn9hmN.description:
The ash skeleton crumbles to ash or reforms in a standing position. While ash, the ash skeleton is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobile}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}, and has an automatic result of 28 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as an inanimate pile of ash or layer of soot.

The ash skeleton can remain in this ash form indefinitely.

idkdIpTpMENK2eFu.name: Natural Camouflage
idkdIpTpMENK2eFu.description: Ssalarn's white and blue scales provide natural camouflage. In areas of snow and ice, Ssalarn can move at his full Speed when Sneaking, and he gains a +4 circumstance bonus to Hide.

8JUE6Z13hTUpIAbJ.name: Gelid Breath
8JUE6Z13hTUpIAbJ.description:
The tatzlwyrm belches a puff of frigid vapor into the face of an adjacent creature, which must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:15|traits:damaging-effect] save; the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to this save if it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}. The tatzlwyrm can't use Gelid Breath again for 2 rounds.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 round.

Failure The target takes @Damage[2d6[cold]] damage and is clumsy 1 for 1 round.

Critical Failure The target takes @Damage[4d6[cold]] damage and is clumsy 1 for 1 minute.

The Scholar of Sorts (3-4).name: The Scholar of Sorts (3-4)
The Scholar of Sorts (3-4).description:
Akizendris gnaw at sources of knowledge and lore, gleefully corrupting and altering them to vex scholars and sages across the planes with contradictions and untruths. These proteans appear as cackling, serpentine creatures with elongated crocodilian faces, luminous eyes, and arms that vanish at the elbows into swirling clouds of runes before reforming into solid talons.

Akizendris amuse themselves by rearranging or deleting texts, placing insulting acrostics in poetic verses, and penning crude insults upon title pages. Libraries in such places as Heaven, Axis, and Hell are especially keen to avoid such contamination, knowing that their records are choice targets for every akizendri in existence.

um06dCu0E8W9LRDd.name: Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 30 feet
um06dCu0E8W9LRDd.description: An akizendri can anticipate the most likely location of a creature through their supernatural insight into the forces of chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants the Scholar the ability to sense creatures within the listed range. A creature under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Veil of Privacy} or that is otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions cannot be noticed via entropy sense.

3WqEPpUcLFd5pJv6.name: Protean Anatomy 8
3WqEPpUcLFd5pJv6.description:
An akizendri's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the Scholar takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first.

The Scholar is immune to polymorph effects unless they are a willing target. If @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, the Scholar automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.

tH3f4GsDerHRNPik.name: Change Shape
tH3f4GsDerHRNPik.description:
The Scholar takes on the appearance of any Small or smaller creature. This doesn't change its Speed or its attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes, but might change the damage type its Strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

rB0kJuC158tvKsmj.name: Garbled Thoughts
rB0kJuC158tvKsmj.description:
A creature hit by the Scholar's bite Strike must attempt a @Check[will|dc:22] save.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round.

nIDe1OaPgWDPyBej.name: Text Immersion
nIDe1OaPgWDPyBej.description:
When the Scholar casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VVAZPCvd4d90qVA1]{Secret Page}, it can physically immerse itself in the text, changing the message of the text in the process. It can exit the book at any point by Dismissing secret page, at which point it appears in a space adjacent to the text. If it does so to begin combat, it rolls a Deception check for initiative.

As long as it remains immersed in the text, the Scholar has no body. It can communicate telepathically with a creature as long as the creature touches the book or scroll that contains the secret page. It can sense nearby creatures using its entropy sense, but not in any other way, nor can it use any attack, manipulate, or move actions or speak aloud. If the object they are immersed in is destroyed, the Scholar reappears in an adjacent square and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

OJm7rYI5Ruon3nTT.name: Text Passage
OJm7rYI5Ruon3nTT.description:
Requirements The Scholar is adjacent to a text they have modified with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VVAZPCvd4d90qVA1]{Secret Page}, and another such text is within 500 feet

Effect The Scholar has a way with words beyond other akizendris. They physically immerse themself into the adjacent text, which they use as a medium to teleport to another text within 500 feet that they have modified with secret page. Once they enter the first text, they instantly know the locations of the other texts within range.

Entering a text in this manner automatically dispels the secret page effect on it, but not the secret page effect on the destination text. The locations of the Scholar's modified texts are marked on the map.

Kobold Warrior (PFS 2-11).name: Kobold Warrior (PFS 2-11)
Kobold Warrior (PFS 2-11).description:
The typical kobold trains with agile weaponry, favoring the light pick for its use in crafting new tunnels to expand their domains through underground reaches. Kobolds are capable of landing sneaky strikes against unsuspecting foes but are just as quick to scamper off to safety when they don't, as a group, outnumber their enemies at least two to one.

Kobolds are small, reptilian humanoids who carry physical similarities to true dragons. They lurk in dark spaces, usually tunnels and mines beneath the earth, in either warrens of their own design or complexes discovered and colonized after the original builders have moved on. Though kobolds are far more pragmatic than they are courageous, they use every inch of their cunning to even the playing field between themselves and other, stronger creatures. They attack from the darkness and at range, and kobold artificers and engineers master the art of simple but effective traps, which they use to protect their lairs. Kobolds are skilled at working together by necessity, and they often set up ambushes or hit-and-run assaults that allow them to do the most damage possible without being harmed in return.

Kobolds are diligent and hardworking creatures, though they often turn these virtues toward selfish ends. While some kobolds live in communal collectives that maintain neutral relations with the creatures around them, they can be easily swayed into serving malevolent powers or megalomaniac leaders. This is in part due to kobolds' innate pragmatism, as they would rather concede to servitude than risk being killed, but it is also in part due to a reverence for the power that kobolds generally lack. Dragons in particular are viewed with a deferential awe, and kobolds eagerly offer their services to such mighty and glorious creatures when they can. While kobolds may scheme against other leaders, especially those that control them via subjugation, dragons are usually viewed with adoration, no matter how brutal they might be to their kobold minions.

dF7ibA1On3Nvjxqk.name: Hurried Retreat
dF7ibA1On3Nvjxqk.description:
Requirements The kobold warrior is adjacent to at least one enemy.
