Effect The kobold warrior Strides up to its Speed plus 5 feet and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by this movement. It must end this movement in a space that's not adjacent to any enemy.

D0BJOT03V2FE7mKT.name: Sneak Attack
D0BJOT03V2FE7mKT.description: The kobold warrior deals an extra 1d4 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Hunting Spider (PFS 2-18).name: Hunting Spider (PFS 2-18)
Hunting Spider (PFS 2-18).description:
Hunting spiders are the most common type of giant spider, though not the largest.

Few everyday vermin inspire as much dread as the infamous spider.

DbfLZXVZVTQMJoyI.name: Web Sense
DbfLZXVZVTQMJoyI.description: The hunting spider has imprecise @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.j2wsK6IsW5yMW1jW]{Tremorsense} to detect the vibrations of creatures touching its web.

4lmj5hd20I5GvQJz.name: Spring Upon Prey
4lmj5hd20I5GvQJz.description:
Requirements Initiative has not yet been rolled.

Trigger A creature touches the hunting spider's web while the spider is on it.

Effect The hunting spider automatically notices the creature and Strides, Climbs, or Descends on a Web before it rolls initiative.

tHBnPDgoj9trVlBk.name: Descend on a Web
tHBnPDgoj9trVlBk.description:
The hunting spider moves straight down up to 40 feet, suspended by a web line. It can hang from the web or drop off. The distance it Descends on a Web doesn't count for falling damage.

A creature that successfully Strikes the web (AC 20, Hardness 3, 5 HP) severs it, causing the spider to fall.

egV0y60X9Okkmuoc.name: Hunting Spider Venom
egV0y60X9Okkmuoc.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:16]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d10[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d12[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, and off-guard (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, and off-guard (1 round)

Qy7s2ZDFTvr7xR1m.name: Web Trap
Qy7s2ZDFTvr7xR1m.description: A creature hit by the hunting spider's web attack is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} and stuck to the nearest surface until it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes} (DC 17).

Cobbleswarm (B5).name: Cobbleswarm (B5)
Cobbleswarm (B5).description:
Cobble mites resemble squarish stones a few inches across with mouths like split geodes. Though indolent and harmless alone, they're dangerous in large groups.

Busy road builders might unknowingly use cobble mites in construction.

jmLRUmx1Vp2TnZd6.name: Tremorsense (Precise) 40 feet, (Imprecise) 80 feet
jmLRUmx1Vp2TnZd6.description: A cobbleswarm's tremorsense is a precise sense out to 40 feet and an imprecise sense out to 80 feet. A cobbleswarm can't sense anything beyond the range of its tremorsense.

deXYiHJyBjDSNFF5.name: Grasping Bites
deXYiHJyBjDSNFF5.description:
The cobbleswarm attempts an @Check[athletics] check and compares the result to the Fortitude DC of each creature in its space. This counts as two attacks for the cobbleswarm's multiple attack penalty.

Critical Success The creature falls prone, takes @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning]] damage, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the cobbleswarm until the end of the cobbleswarm's next turn.

Success The creature falls prone.

MdAaSnMbM5KOAlWl.name: Pummeling Assault
MdAaSnMbM5KOAlWl.description: Each foe in the cobbleswarm's space takes @Damage[2d4[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic] save).

hMMv22qixXyOKYYo.name: It's My Desire
hMMv22qixXyOKYYo.description:
Trigger A planar nixie uses Grant Desire to grant Perizia's request

Effect Perizia uses her power over wishes to amplify the nixie's ability. The planar nixie can duplicate a spell of up to 3rd level instead of a spell of up to 2nd level.

iI9TQ9ckuflPhAJn.name: Vortex
iI9TQ9ckuflPhAJn.description: 40 feet. Water in the aura's emanation that is also in the same body of water as Perizia is difficult terrain for swimming creatures. Creatures with the water trait are immune.

gdaiqmfQbRAaM8zG.name: Change Shape
gdaiqmfQbRAaM8zG.description:
Perizia can take on the appearance of any water elemental or humanoid. This ability doesn't change her Speed or her attack and damage bonuses with her Strikes.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

9PdSUPCOObuXj7QP.name: Improvised Wishcraft
9PdSUPCOObuXj7QP.description:
Effect Perizia goads a creature into making a wish she can twist. Though Perizia isn't a noble genie and doesn't have access to the full power of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish} spell, her aspirations for power and studies of wishcraft have given her a lesser ability to twist the desires of others into ruin. The creature chooses the type of wish: a wish for power, a wish for wealth, or a wish for happiness. Once the type of wish is chosen, the creature attempts a @Check[will|dc:22] save. The effects of all granted wishes end after 1 hour. After attempting a saving throw, a creature is temporarily immune to this ability for 24 hours.

Critical Success The creature phrases its wish with the precision necessary to get a good outcome. The benefit it receives depends on the type of wish it made.

  • Wish for power-A burst of water empowers the creature's attacks. The creature's attacks deal an additional @Damage[1d4[bludgeoning]] damage.
  • Wish for wealth-A sack appears at the creature's waist, containing obvious fake coins and one of the following, of the creature's choice: 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.G7haQ5gDt30ftJLC]{Healing Potion (Moderate)}, 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.YHev1WJ2tOiTBg9o]{Oil of Unlife (Moderate)}, or 5 vials of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.97QyNEOAyYLdGaYc]{Bottled Lightning (Moderate)}. After 1 hour, all of these objects disappear.
  • Wish for happiness-The creature feels hopeful and inspired, gaining a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and saves against fear effects.

Success The creature resists making the wish.

Failure The creature's wish is twisted to cause it harm. The penalty it receives depends on the type of wish it made.

  • Wish for power-The creature's body is rapidly pushed to its limits of physical exertion and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.
  • Wish for wealth-The creature's pockets and bags fill with temporary treasures that resist all attempts to discard. The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.D5mg6Tc7Jzrj6ro7]{Encumbered}.
  • Wish for happiness-Tiny flashes of pleasant emotions and positive memories flicker across the creature's mind, interspersing with reality in a profoundly disorienting manner. The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}, and can't reduce this condition until the effects of the wish end.

Critical Failure The creature phrases its wish poorly, and Perizia easily twists the outcome. In addition to the failure effect of the creature's chosen type of wish, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

6KUKMyYujA05w8AR.name: Skewer
6KUKMyYujA05w8AR.description: Perizia makes a trident Strike, dealing an extra @Damage[1d4[bleed]] on a hit (@Damage[2d4[bleed]] on a critical hit).

Young Ahuizotl.name: Young Ahuizotl
Young Ahuizotl.description:
The ahuizotl is a vicious, semi-aquatic predator that resembles a hideous cross between a badger and an otter, with disturbingly web-fingered paws supplemented by a fifth hand at the end of a long, serpentine tail. A clever and stealthy hunter, the ahuizotl lures unwary prey to their doom by mimicking the cries of people in distress.

The ahuizotl's macabre habit of feeding on a victim's eyes, fingernails, and teeth leaves the corpses of its kills uniquely mutilated. Some say the creatures consider these body parts delicacies, while others insist ahuizotls collect them as tribute to a powerful but unknown entity.

The fact that an ahuizotl does not eat the actual flesh of its victims, instead depositing their savaged and waterlogged corpses in locations where the remains are sure to be found by friends or family, points to a third and perhaps more likely possibility-the ahuizotl simply enjoys using its violent dietary quirks to spread fear and despair.

An ahuizotl walks on all fours, but its hands are capable of manipulating simple tools and other objects. Ahuizotls have roughly mustelid features and an extra membrane covering their eyes, giving their eyes a dull color suggestive of cataracts and somewhat blunting the creature's vision.

Yet despite their bestial appearance, ahuizotls are nearly as intelligent as the average human, and wiser than most. Although they don't form societies of their own, they have been known to ally with violent cults or conclaves of monsters, and even to found small shrines and temples to sinister deities.

The cult of Charon, the horseman of Death, is particularly popular among certain ahuizotls, who look forward to an afterlife spent wallowing in the waters of the River Styx.

YgxWUbqgAc3iKOYz.name: Voice Imitation
YgxWUbqgAc3iKOYz.description: An ahuizotl can mimic the sounds of a person in distress by attempting a Deception check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ewwCglB7XOPLUz72]{Lie}. The ahuizotl has a +4 circumstance bonus to this check.

0Vv2R9JCAdMBeLqh.name: Tail Drag
0Vv2R9JCAdMBeLqh.description:
Requirements The ahuizotl has a Medium or smaller creature grabbed with its tail claw

Effect The ahuizotl attempts an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the creature's Fortitude DC.

Critical Success If the creature is 10 feet away from the ahuizotl, it is dragged into a square adjacent to the ahuizotl. The ahuizotl can make a jaws Strike against the creature.

Success If the creature is 10 feet away from the ahuizotl, it is dragged into a square adjacent to the ahuizotl.

Failure The creature is not dragged.

Critical Failure The creature is not dragged and the ahuizotl no longer has the creature grabbed.

XbTD7oBK1dYTt4M9.name: Death Frenzy
XbTD7oBK1dYTt4M9.description:
Trigger The Usij cultist is reduced to 0 Hit Points, and the cultist can see or hear a div within 60 feet

Effect The Usij cultist makes a melee Strike before dying.

Awakened Megalania.name: Awakened Megalania
Awakened Megalania.description: Megalanias, like their smaller cousins the giant monitor lizards, strike fast and use their powerful bite to grip their prey. They prefer to swallow their prey whole rather than risk others getting a bite of a hard-won meal.

YkuWnKDR7iQkfOh8.name: Megalania Venom
YkuWnKDR7iQkfOh8.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:25]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 3}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} (1 round)

icMP8x2L8sLVpCPP.name: Construct Armor
icMP8x2L8sLVpCPP.description: Like normal objects, the guardian dogu has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once the guardian is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 20.

RurmrfKLGW9f3iez.name: Ley Line Surge
RurmrfKLGW9f3iez.description:
A to 3

Frequency once per day

Effect The Kayajima guardian pulses with mystical energies that emit a pale blue glow before it emits a wave of force. If the Kayajima guardian uses 1 action to use, it unleashes a powerful blast that deals @Damage[3d6[force]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[cone|distance:15]. If the Kayajima guardian uses 2 actions to use Ley Line Surge, increase the size of the cone to @Template[cone|distance:30] and the damage to @Damage[5d6[force]] damage. If the Kayajima guardian uses 3 actions to use Ley Line Surge, increase the size of the cone to @Template[cone|distance:60] and the damage to @Damage[6d6[force]] damage.

Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:19|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is pushed 5 feet.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is pushed 10 feet.

Frpc0KRkdnPN6zjA.name: Sudden Charge
Frpc0KRkdnPN6zjA.description: The Kayajima guardian propels itself with jets of blue energy from its feet, dashing up to a foe and swinging its fist. It Strides twice. If it ends its movement within melee range of at least one enemy, it can make an energized fist Strike against that enemy.

fkq1TSG0x7hYCInK.name: Mist Cloud
fkq1TSG0x7hYCInK.description: 15 feet. The mist stalker is surrounded by mist. Creatures in the aura are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}. If wind disperses the aura, it returns automatically at the start of the mist stalker's turn. This cloud is suppressed in water.

wq7AwC0AWPfxZEfd.name: Mist Vision
wq7AwC0AWPfxZEfd.description: The mist stalker ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from mist and fog.

6qDmvQYxOjvP6fjc.name: Solidify Mist
6qDmvQYxOjvP6fjc.description: The mist stalker makes its mist cloud congeal, causing the aura to be difficult terrain until the start of the mist stalker's next turn. In addition, the mist stalker can make the mist even thicker around a single Medium or smaller creature within the cloud. The creature must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:21|name:Solidfy Mist] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until it Escapes or it is no longer in the mist cloud's emanation.

7Dwwk4c4cBxweZKc.name: Blood Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet
7Dwwk4c4cBxweZKc.description: A mandragora can smell creatures with blood as an imprecise sense at a range of 30 feet, and it can smell demons, fey, and sorcerers with blood as a precise sense at a range of 30 feet.

eTTWHexqpmKAYC0k.name: Blood Drain
eTTWHexqpmKAYC0k.description:
Requirements The mandragora has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The mandragora drains blood from the creature it has grabbed, dealing [[/r {2d6}]]{2d6 damage}. If the creature is a demon, fey, or sorcerer, the mandragora gains temporary Hit Points equal to the damage dealt.

A creature that has its blood drained by a mandragora is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} until it receives healing of any kind or amount.

Xlbal6st53Tv5z83.name: Bruorsivi Sap Infusion
Xlbal6st53Tv5z83.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:19]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage and stupefied 1 (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[fire]] damage and stupefied 1 (1 round)

IOvxdhkIi0W0wzzB.name: Piercing Shriek
IOvxdhkIi0W0wzzB.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The mandragora emits an unsettling shriek. Each non-mandragora creature within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[will|dc:23] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is sickened 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. As long as the creature remains sickened, this slowed condition value can't be reduced below 1.

icMP8x2L8sLVpCPP.name: Construct Armor
icMP8x2L8sLVpCPP.description: Like normal objects, the guardian dogu has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once the guardian is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 22.

RurmrfKLGW9f3iez.name: Ley Line Surge
RurmrfKLGW9f3iez.description:
A to 3

n

Frequency once per day

Effect The Kayajima guardian pulses with mystical energies that emit a pale blue glow before it emits a wave of force. If the Kayajima guardian uses 1 action to use, it unleashes a powerful blast that deals @Damage[4d6[force]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[cone|distance:15]. If the Kayajima guardian uses 2 actions to use Ley Line Surge, increase the size of the cone to @Template[cone|distance:30] and the damage to @Damage[6d6[force]] damage. If the Kayajima guardian uses 3 actions to use Ley Line Surge, increase the size of the cone to @Template[cone|distance:60] and the damage to @Damage[8d6[force]] damage.

Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:22|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is pushed 5 feet.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is pushed 10 feet.

Frpc0KRkdnPN6zjA.name: Sudden Charge
Frpc0KRkdnPN6zjA.description: The Kayajima guardian propels itself with jets of blue energy from its feet, dashing up to a foe and swinging its fist. It Strides twice. If it ends its movement within melee range of at least one enemy, it can make an energized fist Strike against that enemy.

zZhXDr0O3nKNwMa4.name: Broad Swipe
zZhXDr0O3nKNwMa4.description: The skeleton makes two Strikes with its bo staff against two adjacent foes, both of whom are within its reach. The multiple attack penalty does not increase until after both attacks are resolved.

ywp4JyHQAVo3iLhj.name: Explosive Death
ywp4JyHQAVo3iLhj.description: When the skeleton is destroyed, its bones shatter and explode as the necromantic energy holding it together is released. Adjacent creatures take @Damage[2d6[slashing]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:17|basic] save

IJWwhJN9hAWZSUST.name: Terrifying Charge
IJWwhJN9hAWZSUST.description: The skeleton Strides and makes a claw Strike with a +4 circumstance bonus to damage circumstance bonus to damage. If the strike hits, the skeleton attempts to [[/act demoralize]] the target.

UsNXrh4jdzcpLKuK.name: Handout Information
UsNXrh4jdzcpLKuK.description: In combat, Ogthup is a minion. Once per round, any PC can spend an action to command Ogthup (this has the auditory, concentrate, and linguistic traits), and have her take two actions. If reduced below 15 HP, Ogthup scampers away and dives into a snowdrift, to return once the coast is clear. If reduced to 0 HP, she falls unconscious rather than dying immediately.

dlOMusio9j98rfRb.name: Sidle-Stab!-Scamper
dlOMusio9j98rfRb.description: Ogthup takes a Stride action, and at any point during her move can take a Strike action.

8GHsGNis4Wn9Fob5.name: Sneak Attack
8GHsGNis4Wn9Fob5.description: Ogthup deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

qITipsKZASBgK8d2.name: Consume Lightning
qITipsKZASBgK8d2.description:
Trigger The storm bear is targeted by, or in the area of, an effect that deals electricity damage

Effect The storm bear devours some of the electricity to fuel a quick burst of speed, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 round. While quickened, the storm bear's motions produce visible sparks of electricity.

e3RlQHfH1zTKEKwf.name: Thunderous Roar
e3RlQHfH1zTKEKwf.description:
The storm bear unleashes a deafening roar. Any non-storm bear creature within 10 feet takes @Damage[2d10[sonic]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:19|basic] save); creatures that critically fail this save are deafened for [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds}.

The storm bear can't use Thunderous Roar again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Thunderous Roar]]{1d4 rounds}.

vGThkFmJksPhr6zI.name: Favored Prey
vGThkFmJksPhr6zI.description: A bulette gains a +1 circumstance bonus to attack and damage rolls with its jaws against a specific type of creature designated as its favorite food. Unless otherwise stated, a bulette's favored prey is halflings. Elves are never a favored prey for bulettes

W2DmmcacVVfMzKKI.name: Leaping Charge
W2DmmcacVVfMzKKI.description: The bulette attempts a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2HJ4yuEFY1Cast4h]{High Jump} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.JUvAvruz7yRQXfz2]{Long Jump}. If it's adjacent to an enemy at the apex of its High Jump or at the end of its Long Jump, it can make a claw Strike against the enemy at that moment. If the bulette jumps at least 5 feet vertically or at least 20 feet horizontally, it can attempt two claw Strikes instead of one. The bulette's multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until it has made all the claw Strikes that are part of its Leaping Charge.

8qLsjjKefZX3z28i.name: Powerful Jumper
8qLsjjKefZX3z28i.description: A bulette jumps 10 feet up on a successful @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2HJ4yuEFY1Cast4h]{High Jump} or 20 feet up on a critical success.

G6iIf6shT68NDbTW.name: Ice Stride
G6iIf6shT68NDbTW.description: A frost troll hunter isn't impeded by difficult terrain caused by snow or ice, nor do they need to attempt Acrobatics checks to keep from falling on slippery ice.

OPBJuHhEVoiEk4mU.name: Skirmish Strike
OPBJuHhEVoiEk4mU.description: The frost troll hunter's feet and weapons move in tandem. They can either Step and then Strike, or Strike and then Step.

85kxXW17gvaJu9KH.name: Explosive Death
85kxXW17gvaJu9KH.description: When the skeleton is destroyed, its bones shatter and explode as the necromantic energy holding it together is released. Adjacent creatures take @Damage[1d6[slashing]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:15|basic] save.

Awakened Ball Python.name: Awakened Ball Python
Awakened Ball Python.description:
This nonvenomous snake's name comes from its tendency to curl into a ball when frightened, though most people know it for its hunting tactic of coiling around prey and crushing victims with its powerful muscles. Nonetheless, brave herpetologists sometimes keep ball pythons as pets.

Snakes come in an array of forms, from jungle-dwelling constrictors that wrap around their prey to venomous vipers with deadly bites. Regardless, all snakes consume their prey whole by unhinging their jaws and using powerful muscles to move the food down their throats and into their stomachs.

NeJvQpMPGMIfzdCG.name: Tighten Coils
NeJvQpMPGMIfzdCG.description:
Trigger A creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by the ball python attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape}.

Effect The DC of the Escape check is increased by 2.

l6OEi0DzuPlz6OeT.name: Wrap in Coils
l6OEi0DzuPlz6OeT.description:
Requirements A Medium or smaller creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in the ball python's jaws.

Effect The ball python moves the creature into its coils, freeing its jaws to make attacks, then uses Constrict against the creature. The ball python's coils can hold one creature.

1ICSGdDVtFdFoByC.name: Wild Empathy
1ICSGdDVtFdFoByC.description: The planar nixie can use Diplomacy to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression} on and make very simple Requests of aquatic or amphibious animals and elementals.

I8sLwLez9AlCWQY5.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

8z1MC2ykPvZPeOtL.name: Grant Desire
8z1MC2ykPvZPeOtL.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The planar nixie can duplicate a spell of up to 3rd level, but only in response to the request or desire of a non-fey creature. The creature whose desire is granted can never again benefit from that particular planar nixie's Grant Desire ability.

Saddleback Bunyip.name: Saddleback Bunyip
Saddleback Bunyip.description:
Bunyips are dangerous aquatic predators that resemble a cross between a shark and a seal. Found in freshwater inlets or saltwater coves worldwide, bunyips hunt where prey is plentiful, often to the consternation of coastal residents and fisherfolk.

Despite their outlandish appearance and tendency to defend their territory with loud, bellowing roars that echo for great distances, bunyips are very rarely sighted by humanoids, leaving many to question their existence. For hundreds of years, bunyips were widely regarded as nothing more than folk tales, and even now that their existence as a species has been proven, the existence of any particular bunyip in a local area is often met with heavy skepticism. While their limited shapechanging abilities are no doubt a significant part of the reason for this air of mystery, another major factor is that the aquatic creatures rarely hunt humanoids, preferring to eat smaller animals. Most bunyips avoid human contact, except when one wanders too close to their den or favorite hunting spot, at which point the territorial bunyip attacks with swift and terrible ferocity. Many scholars agree that a large number of unexplained disappearances near coastal areas are the result of unreported bunyip aggression.

In some ports, bunyips have learned that delicious prizes can be had from the chum and garbage discarded by fishing boats and merchant vessels. They lurk close to the shore and carefully choose their victims, plucking them off docks and small boats. These bunyips are particularly careful to keep their true forms hidden, but this does little to dull rumors of monster-infested waters.

i8xGkDyTBirx7HaW.name: Blood Scent
i8xGkDyTBirx7HaW.description: The bunyip can smell blood in the water from up to 1 mile away.

4WwWjUOGDnJncjWj.name: Aquatic Opportunity
4WwWjUOGDnJncjWj.description: As @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.hFtNbo1LKYCoDy2O]{Attack of Opportunity}, but both the bunyip and the triggering creature must be in water.

4wMDNNrvnJFAi5UI.name: Blood Frenzy
4wMDNNrvnJFAi5UI.description:
Requirements The bunyip is not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} or already in a frenzy.

Trigger The bunyip deals bleed damage to a living creature.

Effect The bunyip flies into a frenzy that lasts 1 minute. While frenzied, the bunyip gains a +4 status bonus to damage rolls with its jaws, gains 8 temporary HP that go away at the end of the frenzy, and takes a -2 penalty to AC.

bdrrSnIH32ERMP25.name: Roar
bdrrSnIH32ERMP25.description: The bunyip lets out a loud and horrifying roar. Other creatures within 100 feet must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:21] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} on a success, or unaffected on a critical success). No matter the result, the creature is temporarily immune to the effect for 1 minute.

yFqMLM1iygDqwiZC.name: Shift Form
yFqMLM1iygDqwiZC.description: A bunyip can alter its form slightly to gain an advantage and make it harder to recognize. When it does, its teeth shrink and its Jaws Strike doesn't deal the 1d6 persistent bleed damage. It can choose to gain either a long snake tail, granting its tail Strike reach 10 feet and Grab, or squat crocodile legs, increasing its land Speed to 20 feet. If it uses Shift Form again, the bunyip can return to normal or switch between a long tail or crocodile legs.

XzF99LVgYbgcg3jM.name: Shell Block
XzF99LVgYbgcg3jM.description:
Trigger A creature adjacent to the dragon turtle targets it with a melee attack.

Effect The dragon turtle rolls its shell toward the triggering creature, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to its AC against the triggering attack.

SxzPmzzRILX0GL4D.name: Breath Weapon
SxzPmzzRILX0GL4D.description:
The dragon turtle breathes a massive blast of steam that deals @Damage[6d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to creatures within a @Template[cone|distance:40] (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save). This steam blast affects creatures within the water, as well as outside.

The dragon turtle can't use its Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

ayKccHg7VU6CvDA0.name: Capsize
ayKccHg7VU6CvDA0.description: The dragon turtle tries to capsize an adjacent aquatic vessel of its size or smaller. The dragon turtle must succeed at an Athletics check with a DC of 24 or the pilot's Sailing Lore DC, whichever is higher.

qJyDVXrr1oJKVjFF.name: Draconic Frenzy
qJyDVXrr1oJKVjFF.description: The dragon turtle makes two claw Strikes and one jaws Strike in any order.

eFeUEWJ1TjADrQjO.name: Explode
eFeUEWJ1TjADrQjO.description: When the flaming eye dies, it explodes in a violent burst of flame, dealing @Damage[2d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:16|basic] save) to creatures in a @Template[burst|distance:5].

JcQoBgvXSuvXTbMx.name: Hamstring
JcQoBgvXSuvXTbMx.description:
Frequency once per round

The Scorched Earth clipper makes a melee Strike, attempting to sever connective tissues and disable its foe. If it hits, in addition to taking @Damage[(1d6+8)[slashing]] damage, the creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save, with the following effects.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is off-guard and takes a -5 foot status penalty to its movement until the end of its next turn.

Critical Failure As failure, and the creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

xrWVwtlEByoXum0Y.name: Sneak Attack
xrWVwtlEByoXum0Y.description: Scorched Earth orcs deal an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

0XHcgxkgDqsXBxpu.name: Curse of the Spiraling Maelstrom
0XHcgxkgDqsXBxpu.description:
Trigger A creature adjacent to Silaqui successfully hits her with a Strike.

Effect The attacker takes @Damage[2d6[slashing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save) as they are battered by high-pressure water currents.

YjZsr4inH9qTVsVo.name: Daeodon Charge
YjZsr4inH9qTVsVo.description: The daeodon Strides twice and then makes a tusk Strike. As long as it moved at least 20 feet, it gains a +2 circumstance bonus to its attack roll. A Medium or smaller creature struck by this attack must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:21] save or be knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} by the force of the blow.

TOOcJmFQzc4oXTpe.name: Odru: Wind and Wavesense
TOOcJmFQzc4oXTpe.description: Odru's faith extends her wavesense to a range of 60 feet and allows it to function equally well in clouds of water droplets or vapor, such as mist. (Odru only.)

QvMX0E3ZQln2Bb1I.name: Shark Commune 150 feet
QvMX0E3ZQln2Bb1I.description: The sea devil can communicate telepathically with sharks within range. It can communicate only simple concepts like "come," "guard," or "attack."

c0Rop5BsChQwTXjP.name: Sythi: Nervous Retreat
c0Rop5BsChQwTXjP.description:
Trigger An ally ends a move action adjacent to Sythi.

Effect Sythi hides behind his ally. He Steps to another square adjacent to the triggering ally and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to his AC against the next attack that targets him. (Sythi only.)

5mEQuzEua8VM5vjF.name: Blood Frenzy
5mEQuzEua8VM5vjF.description:
Requirements The sea devil is not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} or already in a frenzy

Trigger The sea devil deals bleed damage to a living creature.

Effect The sea devil flies into a frenzy that lasts 1 minute. While frenzied, the sea devil gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls with its claws and jaws, gains a +4 status bonus to damage rolls with its claws and jaws, gains 15 temporary HP until the end of the frenzy, and takes a -2 status penalty to AC. The sea devil can't voluntarily stop its frenzy. After its frenzy, the sea devil is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.

ZD2utUKEeYWYhfjw.name: Bloodletting
ZD2utUKEeYWYhfjw.description: When the sea devil deals piercing or slashing damage, it also deals @Damage[1d4[bleed]] if the target was @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} or if the attack was a critical hit.

tG7YbIQ0JzByE7yL.name: Rahla: Applied Anesthesia
tG7YbIQ0JzByE7yL.description: Rahla's scalpel is coated with a disorienting agent. The first creature she successfully hits with a scalpel strike must succeed on a @Check[fortitude|dc:24|traits:poison] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}; this is a poison effect. (Rahla only.)

mqsb9fOkcaNyASnJ.name: Sneak Attack
mqsb9fOkcaNyASnJ.description: The saboteur deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

f2tBEfQluaaEyFuM.name: Surprise Attack
f2tBEfQluaaEyFuM.description: On the first round of combat, if the saboteur rolls Deception or Stealth for initiative, creatures that haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to them.

Jinkin (PFS 2-00).name: Jinkin (PFS 2-00)
Jinkin (PFS 2-00).description:
Jinkins are sadistic tinkers who steal and sabotage items and take great pride in their power to curse precious objects. They hold grudges and create convoluted plans for revenge whenever they feel slighted, such as when a creature dares to remove one of their curses. Rarely content to wreak simple mayhem, jinkins also take immense pleasure in torture and murder, though they prefer to lead victims into traps designed to capture or incapacitate rather than kill outright. Deep pits are favorites, since victims who survive the fall face a slow death from starvation and thirst. Jinkins enjoy gathering at the edge of pits to mock, tease, and torment.

Gremlins are cruel fey tricksters and saboteurs who have fully acclimated to life on the Material Plane, finding distinct niches for their inventive destructiveness. All gremlins delight in ruining or breaking things, whether it's something physical like a device or vehicle or something intangible such as an alliance or relationship. A gremlin's greatest joy is watching the collapse of complex creations, preferably after the lightest and slightest, carefully targeted push from the gremlin. Gremlins tend to denigrate, bully, or even slaughter their lesser kin, particularly mitflits, whom gremlins (and many others) derisively call "mites."

oObpBdGWzojxRdfS.name: Sneak Attack
oObpBdGWzojxRdfS.description: The jinkin deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

fHam88iT0r3U5tcl.name: Tinker
fHam88iT0r3U5tcl.description: A group of six jinkins can work together for an hour to imbue an item with a curse at a range of 60 feet. While this process is lengthy, it's also unobtrusive and can be performed while @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hiding}. Jinkins prefer to use this ability on magic items. The curse makes the item unreliable (@Check[flat|dc:5] check or waste any action to Interact with or Activate the item), adds a bizarre requirement to use the item, or imparts some other curse of a similar caliber.

0AYBgeZHXC2owEcl.name: Deny Advantage
0AYBgeZHXC2owEcl.description: Drandle Dreng isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to flanking, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} creatures of 10th-level or lower, or creatures of 10th-level or lower using surprise attack.

Z48JRCf4URMUM0Q9.name: Evasion
Z48JRCf4URMUM0Q9.description: When Drandle Dreng rolls a success on a Reflex save, he get a critical success instead.

UykzrkInyoNAKmim.name: Sidestep
UykzrkInyoNAKmim.description:
Trigger The attack roll for a Strike targeting Drandle Dreng fails or critically fails

Effect Drandle Dreng redirects the attack to a creature of his choice that is adjacent to him and within the reach of the triggering attack. The attacker rerolls the Strike's attack roll against the new target.

vL7u3rlO2YAb82SH.name: Surprise Attack
vL7u3rlO2YAb82SH.description: On the first round of combat, if Drandle Dreng rolls Deception or Stealth for initiative, creatures who haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to him.

7GiqeIEHanCrZN5h.name: Debilitating Strike
7GiqeIEHanCrZN5h.description:
Trigger Drandle Dreng's Strike hits an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creature and deals damage

Effect Drandle Dreng chooses one of the following debilitations for the target, which lasts until the end of his next turn:

  • it can't flank or contribute to allies' flanking,
  • it takes a -10-foot status penalty to its Speeds,
  • or it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}.

GRRU6CL37dvFlwaU.name: Mobility
GRRU6CL37dvFlwaU.description: When Drandle Dreng Strides half his Speed or less, that movement doesn't trigger reactions.

5ULu0OsCskg71fjK.name: Skirmish Strike
5ULu0OsCskg71fjK.description: Drandle Dreng either Steps and then Strikes, or Strikes and then Steps.

r3vUpJDQI6ajElwr.name: Sneak Attack
r3vUpJDQI6ajElwr.description: Drandle Dreng deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

sTilPlp6SfdLJsA8.name: Tumble Behind
sTilPlp6SfdLJsA8.description: When Drandle Dreng successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.21WIfSu7Xd7uKqV8]{Tumbles Through}, the foe whose space he passed through is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the next attack he makes before the end of his turn.

9Sddw4NHUW8dEcII.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

ZKEB9TXW3zTrnq2F.name: Urxehl's Grace
ZKEB9TXW3zTrnq2F.description:
Trigger Urxehl's firestorm targets a creature

Effect The Disciple of Urxehl redirects the firestorm, causing it to target a different creature of the Disciple's choice.

3Y0DD3yigmZsYOwO.name: Channel Firestorm
3Y0DD3yigmZsYOwO.description: If the next action the Disciple of Urxehl takes is to Cast a Spell, any creature that has taken damage from Urxehl's firestorm since the Disciple's last turn takes a -2 circumstance penalty to AC and saves against the spell.

Brittle Skeletal Horse.name: Brittle Skeletal Horse
Brittle Skeletal Horse.description:
Skeletal horses are sometimes used as mounts by other undead or monsters.

Made from bones held together by foul necromancy, skeletons are among the most common types of undead, found haunting old dungeons and forgotten cemeteries.

ohwAZH20CeE3uGMp.name: Gallop
ohwAZH20CeE3uGMp.description: The horse Strides twice, with its Speed increased by 10 feet.

1AzFNDZFiaJxTAJf.name: Undead Steed
1AzFNDZFiaJxTAJf.description: Undead and creatures allied with them can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.q9nbyIF0PEBqMtYe]{Command} a skeletal steed without needing to attempt a skill check.

EFJbwURtmwbvaitP.name: Winter Wise
EFJbwURtmwbvaitP.description: Chesjilawa can see normally through mist, fog, and all forms of precipitation. She ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition caused by such effects. She ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain from snow and ice and doesn't risk falling when crossing such terrain.

HcnRFHeoFQphRmRs.name: Mirrorshard Spell
HcnRFHeoFQphRmRs.description: A mirror of ice forms around Chesjilawa's hand or wand as she focuses her magic into a more physical form, the better to damage creatures who can resist the cold. If her next action is to Cast a Spell that deals cold damage, the mirror shatters into a blitz of ice shards, changing half of the spell's damage from cold to slashing.

i64w2e9G0PytAjR5.name: Snow Step
i64w2e9G0PytAjR5.description:
Icy flowers bloom around Chesjilawa as she instantly transports herself in a flurry of snow to a space within 120 feet that she can see. The destination must contain ice or snow.

She then can't Snow Step for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

ehGPcGg59UAn28oY.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

3YaoRTg7JFZbGJQg.name: Shackle
3YaoRTg7JFZbGJQg.description:
Requirements The duergar raider has manacles in hand and is adjacent to a creature

Effect The duergar raider makes an attack roll with a [[/r 1d20+8 #Shackle Attack]]{+8 modifier} against the target's AC to bind the creature's wrists or ankles with the manacles. On a success, they apply the manacles.

3fB439OUpIQkniOv.name: Soulsense 60 feet
3fB439OUpIQkniOv.description: A ravener senses the spiritual essence of living and undead creatures within the listed range. Creatures whose material bodies are one unit with their souls, like celestials and fiends, appear brighter to this sense.

h4kxce1ykzfzk439.name: Boneshatter
h4kxce1ykzfzk439.description:
Trigger The ravener husk takes bludgeoning damage

Effect The ravener's brittle bones shatter, spraying bone shards everywhere. Every creature within a @Template[emanation|distance:10] of the ravener husk takes @Damage[5d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|options:area-effect] save).

zn75w61xdsrsbp0f.name: Breath Weapon
zn75w61xdsrsbp0f.description:
The ravener husk breathes a torrent of void energy that deals @Damage[11d6[void]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:40] (@Check[reflex|dc:28|basic|options:area-effect] save).

They can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

taMiq6FtqyhO2Kij.name: Empowered Blood
taMiq6FtqyhO2Kij.description:
The Usij cultists' blood magic strengthens Sezruth. He begins with 2 Blood Points from sacrifices just before the PCs arrived, and gains 1 additional Blood Point for each time the empowered blood hazard is activated in area B. The adjustments are not cumulative.

1-2 Blood Points Sezruth gains 10 temporary Hit Points.

3-4 Blood Points Sezruth gains 10 temporary Hit Points. Sezruth is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened 1} and can use the extra action to Stride toward or Strike the foe it is aware of with the highest Charisma score.

5 or more Blood Points Sezruth gains 15 temporary Hit Points. Sezruth is quickened 1 and can use the extra action to Stride toward or Strike the foe it is aware of with the highest Charisma score

Z5bz0zcya8Rl4EF3.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

8OYkfX1SGDuogKYz.name: Hatred of Beauty
8OYkfX1SGDuogKYz.description: While aghashes hate all mortals, they particularly despise beautiful objects and beautiful or charismatic mortals. When not in physical peril, an aghash is compelled to destroy art and other works of beauty. An aghash can't enter an area of pristine beauty without first marring it in some way. Given a choice, an aghash attacks a foe with the highest Charisma score first. If barred from doing so by force or some magical effect, they take @Damage[1d6[mental]] damage at the end of their turn

RltonTctqXIM2FmD.name: Cursed Gaze
RltonTctqXIM2FmD.description:
The aghash fixes their gaze on one creature they can see within 20 feet. The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:22|name:Curse Gaze] save

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[2d8[mental]] damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[4d8[mental]] damage and becomes either @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (the aghash's choice).

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[8d8[mental]] damage and becomes Frightened 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}.

8LvW9ugfS2Sd2sxJ.name: Sandstorm
8LvW9ugfS2Sd2sxJ.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The aghash creates a temporary sandstorm in a 30-foot emanation that lasts for 5 rounds. Creatures within the emanation take a -4 circumstance penalty to Perception checks and must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:19] save. On a failure, they're forced to hold their breath or else they start suffocating. A creature within the sandstorm at the end of its turn takes @Damage[1d10[slashing]] damage. Divs are immune to all effects of an aghash's sandstorm

0OOTRB9nI9G0zd8v.name: Breath Weapon
0OOTRB9nI9G0zd8v.description:
The scorched earth mephit breathes rocks in a @Template[cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[2d4[fire]|options:area-damage] damage and @Damage[1d4[persistent,fire]] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic|options:area-effect] save).

The scorched earth mephit can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

mCvDWn0uWXNZW1Oq.name: Magma Swim
mCvDWn0uWXNZW1Oq.description: A scorched earth mephit's swim Speed functions only when the elemental is Swimming through magma or molten lava.

eu9kMN9JNocn50Zw.name: Guardian Construct Armor (Hardness 3)
eu9kMN9JNocn50Zw.description:
Like normal objects, the animated guardian has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness.

Once the animated guardian is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 11. It also loses its hardness.

MzG41UtPoUR97Agr.name: Flash of Insight
MzG41UtPoUR97Agr.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger Valgomorus is about to roll a d20

Effect The cyclops peers into an occluded spectrum of possible futures. He gets a success (but not a critical success) on the roll instead of rolling.

oqTdJ8GgyPpxj0Gs.name: Drain Life
oqTdJ8GgyPpxj0Gs.description:
When Valgomorus damages a living creature with his claw Strike, he gains 3 temporary Hit Points and the creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:16] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

Further successful claw Strikes increase the drained value by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of drained 4.

Z7w9qFdE3oh67V3D.name: Swipe
Z7w9qFdE3oh67V3D.description: Valgomorus makes a melee Strike and compares the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within its melee reach and adjacent to each other. Roll damage only once and apply it to each creature hit. A counts as two attacks for Valgomorus's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty does not increase until after both attacks are resolved.

zPvpFOVRVK0Tm89S.name: I Wish You Hadn't Done That
zPvpFOVRVK0Tm89S.description:
Trigger A creature would hit Corvius with an attack roll, or Corvius would fail a saving throw

Frequency one use

Effect The effects of a past wish warp reality in Corvius's favor. If used on a successful attack roll, the attack roll instead critically misses. If used on Corvius's saving throw, Corvius instead critically succeeds at the saving throw.

JtdcV9EPkv8cTFzY.name: Breath Weapon
JtdcV9EPkv8cTFzY.description:
The mephit swarm breathes energy in a @Template[cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[1d10[acid],1d10[cold],1d10[electricity],1d10[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|options:area-effect] save).

The mephit swarm can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

rYtJhqdRrOJV1p7g.name: Swarming Claws
rYtJhqdRrOJV1p7g.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[3d6[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save).

Pixie (PFS 2-00).name: Pixie (PFS 2-00)
Pixie (PFS 2-00).description:
Insatiably curious, overly excitable, and just a bit puckish, pixies are wanderers and tricksters who use their pixie dust to create all sorts of whimsical situations, as well as to defend themselves. Other creatures often have trouble understanding a pixie's rapid, rambling way of speaking.

Elusive, flighty, and ebullient, sprites are what many villagers first imagine when they hear the terms "fey" or "fairy." While their dispositions vary from the benevolent grig to the trickster pixie, all sprites share a connection to magic and diminutive size. This family of fey shares its name with its slightest and most populous member, the common sprite.

0mf0RfMRzuYHP7t3.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

giE56Vm25ZKR3ZJm.name: Sprinkle Pixie Dust
giE56Vm25ZKR3ZJm.description:
The pixie sprinkles pixie dust onto one of its arrows. If the pixie hits a creature with that arrow before the pixie's next turn, the arrow inflicts one of the following special effects instead of dealing damage. Each effect depends on the target's Will save. On a critical hit, the target treats its save result as one degree worse.

  • Charm @Check[will|dc:21|traits:emotion,enchantment,incapacitation,mental] (emotion, enchantment, incapacitation, mental) The target suffers the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vLA0q0WOK2YPuJs6]{Charm} spell, except it doesn't gain a bonus to its save if the only hostile act was the pixie firing its bow, and the pixie can choose to direct the target's adoration toward another creature rather than itself.
  • Memory Loss @Check[will|dc:21|traits:divination,mental] (divination, mental) On a failed Will save, the target loses the last 5 minutes of its memory.
  • Sleep @Check[will|dc:21|traits:enchantment,incapacitation,mental,sleep] (enchantment, incapacitation, mental, sleep) The target suffers the effects of a 3rd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.o4lRVTwSxnOOn5vl]{Sleep} spell.
  • Subdual @Check[will|dc:21|basic|traits:enchantment,mental,nonlethal] (enchantment, mental, nonlethal) The target takes @Damage[4d6[mental]] damage, depending on its basic Will save.

f42OKdvtvGvdcunj.name: Drain Life
f42OKdvtvGvdcunj.description: When the ragewight damages a living creature with its claw Strike, the ragewight gains 3 temporary Hit Points and the creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. Further damage dealt to the creature by the ragewight increases the amount of drain by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4}.

NsZlYqlD0rycOyOo.name: Furious Grab
NsZlYqlD0rycOyOo.description:
Trigger A creature uses a move action to leave a square adjacent to the ragewight

Effect The ragewight attempts an Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} the target.

P90FbI0EgIg4Jd24.name: Rage
P90FbI0EgIg4Jd24.description:
The ragewight goes into a frenzy, gaining 8 temporary Hit Points. Its Strikes deal 2 additional damage, and it takes a -1 penalty to AC.

This lasts for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.z3uyCMBddrPK5umr]{Effect: Rage}

LUR3LU41YQgmVhQw.name: Wight Spawn
LUR3LU41YQgmVhQw.description: A living humanoid slain by a ragewight's claw Strike rises as a spawned wight after [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. This spawned wight is under the command of the ragewight that killed it. It doesn't have the drain life or wight spawn abilities and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for as long as it is a spawned wight. If the creator of the wight spawn dies, the wight spawn becomes a full-fledged, autonomous wight; it regains its free will, gains the drain life and wight spawn abilities, and is no longer clumsy.

4IwBDQDDuT9baOlo.name: Maiden's Mending
4IwBDQDDuT9baOlo.description:
Frequency once per minute

Trigger Mother Forsythe casts a non-cantrip occult spell

Effect Mother Forsythe gains 2 temporary Hit Points that last until the end of her next turn.

d4Zq9o3SvCZDifiP.name: Mist Child
d4Zq9o3SvCZDifiP.description: Mother Forsythe blends in with unnatural subtlety. When she is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, the DC of the flat check to target her is increased to 6 if she's concealed or 12 if she's hidden.

EsRnesFOS55v5HAE.name: Sneak Attack
EsRnesFOS55v5HAE.description: Mother Forsythe deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

UUaxUn8e1vkuaaXd.name: Slow
UUaxUn8e1vkuaaXd.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

MBoQQVoF3ws3HLwy.name: Tangling Kelp
MBoQQVoF3ws3HLwy.description:
Trigger A creature attempts a melee attack against a zombie grindylow with a bludgeoning or slashing weapon

Effect The creature must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:15] saving throw or become tangled in the kelp that surrounds the zombie grindylow, giving the creature a -10 circumstance penalty to its Speeds until it spends a manipulate action to remove the kelp.

yG0DUDJ68F3sYK7P.name: Clinging Suckers
yG0DUDJ68F3sYK7P.description:
When a grindylow Grabs a creature larger than itself, it attaches to that creature. The grabbed creature is not immobilized, but if it moves, the grindylow moves with it.

If the creature is Medium or smaller, it takes a -5-foot status penalty to its Speeds while the grindylow is attached. The grindylow is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} while it is attached to a creature.

8SVJAkGeub65XLkC.name: Jet
8SVJAkGeub65XLkC.description: The grindylow moves up to 60 feet in a straight line through the water without triggering reactions. It can use this ability while grabbing a creature.

It5odVxK75mhokbs.name: Hamstring
It5odVxK75mhokbs.description:
Frequency once per round

The Scorched Earth clipper makes a melee Strike, attempting to sever connective tissues and disable its foe. If it hits, in addition to taking @Damage[(1d6+8)[slashing]] damage, the creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:23] save, with the following effects.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is off-guard and takes a -5 foot status penalty to its movement until the end of its next turn.

Critical Failure As failure, and the creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

y6BxOm4njDasczHh.name: Sneak Attack
y6BxOm4njDasczHh.description: Scorched Earth orcs deal an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

fpVcvq2IUKAFOoAn.name: Mirror Beam
fpVcvq2IUKAFOoAn.description: Mishka can make ranged Strikes by reflecting sunlight off the mirror on his back. Mishka can target only creatures that are above him in elevation with this ability, including those on his back.

JPlTxiH11MrIONwj.name: Rolling Thunder Trample
JPlTxiH11MrIONwj.description:
Medium or smaller, claw, @Check[reflex|dc:25|basic] save.

When Mishka tramples an enemy, he simply rolls over them. Creatures that fail their save are knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, though if they succeed at an Athletics check to Grapple, as a reaction, at the same DC as Rolling Thunder Trample, they grab hold of Mishka's fur and end Mishka's turn on his back.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Trample]

S9kfGak84NNTTvRl.name: Rush
S9kfGak84NNTTvRl.description: Mishka Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. During the Stride, he gains a +10-foot circumstance bonus to his Speed.

cLydPbejmvuvP55z.name: Canny Reversal
cLydPbejmvuvP55z.description:
Trigger An opponent within the Onyx Alliance agent's reach critically fails on a melee Strike targeted at the agent

Effect The Onyx Alliance agent makes a melee Strike or Trip attempt against the opponent and then Steps.

Tqw4tDUBGZZ8fmwr.name: Shadow Retreat
Tqw4tDUBGZZ8fmwr.description:
Frequency once per year

Effect Activating a special ritual taught through the Onyx Alliance, the agent teleports to a safe house located in the Shadow Plane.

Simultaneous with the teleportation, a @Template[emanation|distance:5] of darkness appears where the agent once stood. The darkness lasts for one minute.

FPjWLeDA8csoEgo3.name: Sneak Attack
FPjWLeDA8csoEgo3.description: The Onyx Alliance agents deals an additional 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

M3na0AbE4UOQCZSq.description:
Like normal objects, the anatomical model has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage the model takes by an amount equal to the Hardness.

Once an anatomical model is reduced to fewer than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks, removing the Hardness and reducing its Armor Class to 19.

RVJNNG5muHCPqqnR.name: Slimy Guts
RVJNNG5muHCPqqnR.description: A creature hit by the anatomical model's guts attack is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until it takes an action to remove the guts. A creature critically hit by the anatomical model's guts attack is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes}.

EBDp7Z31AQQfw3lY.name: Infused Items
EBDp7Z31AQQfw3lY.description: Strak carries the following infused items, which last for 24 hours, or until the next time he makes his daily preparations:@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.TZUskLT7yvP7N2co]{Elixir of Life (Lesser)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.SgtqZxt26BdjUmEB]{Acid Flask (Moderate)}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.gWr4q4HiyGhETA8H]{Alchemist's Fire (Moderate)} (12), and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ehss8yPTXxiUdVlJ]{Smokestick (Greater)}.

mlzJ5auFszM10fBY.name: Directional Bombs
mlzJ5auFszM10fBY.description: When throwing an alchemical bomb with the splash trait, Strak can treat the target's space as the first affected square of a @Template[cone|distance:15] directed away from him, potentially allowing him to avoid allies and splash deeper into enemy lines. If the target takes up more than a single square, the target's square closest to Strak is the first affected square of the cone.

zMvebelO9SzHUK7v.name: Quick Bomber
zMvebelO9SzHUK7v.description: Strak draws an alchemical bomb with an Interact action and throws it as a ranged Strike.

MPOQCX5VmgDx3OR4.name: Gunpowder Mastery
MPOQCX5VmgDx3OR4.description: With their rifles' firing ability ruined beyond repair, the soldiers put their gunpowder reserves to use, making explosive arrows and rigging their guns to let off sparks on each successful bayonet Strike. On a critical hit with the bayonet, the target catches fire, taking @Damage[1d8[persistent,fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:21|traits:damaging-effect] negates).

XNHHW7qKLTsiGqJ9.name: Trench Fighter
XNHHW7qKLTsiGqJ9.description: The Russian soldiers have trained extensively to make good use of cover. They receive a +5 circumstance bonus to AC from greater cover and a +3 circumstance bonus from standard cover, rather than +4 and +2, respectively

5oauJ9Fciow42Wnn.name: Bardic Lore
5oauJ9Fciow42Wnn.description: Solvatar can Recall Knowledge on any subject with a +7 modifier.

zPvpFOVRVK0Tm89S.name: I Wish You Hadn't Done That
zPvpFOVRVK0Tm89S.description:
Trigger A creature would hit Corvius with an attack roll, or Corvius would fail a saving throw

Frequency one use

Effect The effects of a past wish warp reality in Corvius's favor. If used on a successful attack roll, the attack roll instead critically misses. If used on Corvius's saving throw, Corvius instead critically succeeds at the saving throw.

Mutated Trollhound.name: Mutated Trollhound
Mutated Trollhound.description:
Trollhounds are squat, slavering beasts akin to trolls in canine form. Requiring vast quantities of meat to fuel their regenerative metabolisms, packs of wild trollhounds prowl the foothills of regions where trolls dwell, their voracious hunger driving them to slaughter and consume any prey they encounter. In some regions, trolls breed trollhounds as pets, utilizing the trollhounds' keen sense of smell to aid in the hunt.

Covered in fetid, weeping sores, trollhounds are carriers of a debilitating contagion known as bloodfire fever. Creatures that contract the disease through the bite of a trollhound experience deep internal pain, as if their blood were on fire. Additional symptoms include loss of muscle coordination, pus-filled blisters, and overall lethargy and fatigue. Other than suffering from skin irritation, both trolls and trollhounds are immune to the major effects of the disease.

Trollhounds are fearless on the hunt and in combat, relying on their ability to regenerate to carry them through. Not even the threat of fire is enough to repel them, as the beasts don't recognize the danger it represents. Nevertheless, fire is one of the most effective tools in combating trollhounds; canny hunters know to burn every last remnant of a supposedly slain trollhound, for their regenerative powers are potent indeed.

While trolls themselves have had great success in domesticating, training, and even befriending trollhounds, the same cannot be said for other would-be masters. Whether impeded by constant exposure to trollhounds' diseased slobber, their ravenous hunger that never seems to be fully sated, or simply their foul personality and quick-to-bite temperament, most attempts to use trollhounds in place of more reliable guardians end in pain, misery, and a pack of feral trollhounds escaping into the hinterlands. Left to their own devices, a pack of escaped trollhounds can breed relatively quickly, and it can take less than a year for a small pack to multiply into a significant threat to the countryside. Best to leave the trollhounds to the trolls, as they say!

0DDWtKSDSWdXnkgj.name: Bloodfire Fever
0DDWtKSDSWdXnkgj.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:20]{ Fortitude}

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 Enfeebled 1 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 day)

Stage 4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 day)

Stage 5 Enfeebled 2, Clumsy 2, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} (1 day)

RNDT57aD8UzBIRVk.name: Pack Attack
RNDT57aD8UzBIRVk.description: The trollhound deals an extra 1d6 damage to any creature within reach of at least two of the trollhound's allies.

Trigger Valgomorus is about to roll a d20

This spawned wight is under the command of the wight that killed it (in this case, Valgomorus). SSJ9DN2uZVefkTOf.name: Hunt Prey
SSJ9DN2uZVefkTOf.description: The Aspis veteran guard designates a single creature they can see and hear, or one they're Tracking, as their prey. The Aspis veteran guard gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} the prey and to Survival checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Track} the prey. This effect lasts until the Aspis veteran guard uses Hunt Prey again.

krvlbavjpLbNGm9I.name: Precision Edge
krvlbavjpLbNGm9I.description: The first time the Aspis veteran guard hits their hunted prey in a round, they deal an additional 1d8 precision damage.

5tHyqFjKhLfvj6oO.name: Mirror Beam
5tHyqFjKhLfvj6oO.description: Mishka can make ranged Strikes by reflecting sunlight off the mirror on his back. Mishka can target only creatures that are above him in elevation with this ability, including those on his back.

RckhCpqFn9TFPg3L.name: Rolling Thunder Trample
RckhCpqFn9TFPg3L.description:
Medium or smaller, claw, @Check[reflex|dc:28|basic] save.

When Mishka tramples an enemy, he simply rolls over them. Creatures that fail their save are knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, though if they succeed at an Athletics check to Grapple, as a reaction, at the same DC as Rolling Thunder Trample, they grab hold of Mishka's fur and end Mishka's turn on his back.

ZQxlQ4vzNdm4ZUEM.description: Mishka Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. During the Stride, he gains a +10-foot circumstance bonus to his Speed.

llP0iPm4qwoX8UZ6.name: Smoke Vision
llP0iPm4qwoX8UZ6.description: The corrupted wildfire ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

K2357WczpsewBpx1.name: Acrid Cloud
K2357WczpsewBpx1.description:
The burning sap that makes up the corrupted wildfire's body sputters and pops, ejecting a cloud of acrid that smoke in a @Template[emanation|distance:10] that lasts for 1 round.

This smoke provides concealment to all creatures within, and deals @Damage[2d4[poison]|options:area-damage] damage to any creature that enters or begins its turn in the cloud (@Check[fortitude|dc:22|basic|options:area-effect]).

A creature that fails is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

DdBcbOs69kmUVmkm.name: Filthy Burn
DdBcbOs69kmUVmkm.description: When the corrupted wildfire successfully strikes a creature with an attack that deals persistent fire damage, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical hit). This condition cannot be reduced below 1 while the creature is subject to the persistent fire damage from the attack, and ends automatically when the persistent fire ends.

mrR6xPNV4YFujksa.name: Blood Siphon
mrR6xPNV4YFujksa.description:
Trigger A creature within 60 feet takes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage}.

Effect The shed blood disperses into a fine mist that Qxal siphons up with their proboscis. Qxal regains @Damage[14[healing]] Hit Points.

dAAfkCznVNT1SBH9.name: Hallucinatory Scale Dust
dAAfkCznVNT1SBH9.description:
30 feet. Fey glamours shed from Qxal's wings like scale dust, causing hallucinations. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:25] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to the scale dust for 24 hours.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature hallucinates that it is beginning to transform into a plant or animal native to their homeland, becoming either @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1}, at Qxal's choice. The condition lasts for 1 hour. Each time a creature fails this save, Qxal can choose an additional condition.

Critical Failure As failure, but the condition value is 2 (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}).

0VQ8msRsnI58Dzyz.name: Cooperative Growth
0VQ8msRsnI58Dzyz.description:
Requirements Qxal's last action was a successful Strike against a creature adjacent to a natural surface.

Effect Vines sprout from the surface, wrapping around the target's limbs. The creature gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} condition. To escape, the creature must succeed on a DC 28 Escape check or break the vines (AC 20, Hardness 4, HP 36, BT 18, weakness 10 to slashing).

2G83FlVGLWw04oTy.name: Flutter
2G83FlVGLWw04oTy.description: Qxal Flies. Any creature they pass within 30 feet of during their Flutter is exposed to their hallucinatory scale dust.

WmUvsISFLTWBCvzx.name: Grasping Visions
WmUvsISFLTWBCvzx.description: Qxal causes one creature within 60 feet who is under a condition from Qxal's hallucinatory scale dust aura to see visions of grasping vines and swarming insects, impeding the target's every move. All squares count as difficult terrain for that creature until the end of Qxal's next turn, and during that time they gain no benefit from any ability that would allow them to ignore difficult terrain.

uhTOSjCBo9dPMbpa.name: Secret Spells
uhTOSjCBo9dPMbpa.description: Qxal knows how to disguise the manifestations of their spellcasting to catch their foes off guard. If the next action they use is Casting a Spell that has a verbal component, they can remove the verbal component. This makes the spell quieter and allows them to cast it in areas where sound can't carry. Additionally, if Qxal has cover or greater cover against or is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from one or more observers while Casting a Spell, they can attempt a @Check[stealth] check against one or more of those observers' Perception DC. If they succeed at their check against an observer's DC, that observer doesn't notice Qxal is casting a spell.

b1geJH47XvkD5cYf.name: Woodland Stride
b1geJH47XvkD5cYf.description: Qxal can pass freely through even the densest jungle. They ignore difficult terrain caused by plants, including plants manipulated by magic.

9shXU3PHIALvpI1A.name: Hunt Prey
9shXU3PHIALvpI1A.description: The Scorched Earth scout designates a single creature they can see and hear, or one they're Tracking, as their prey. The Scorched Earth scout gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} the prey and to Survival checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Track} the prey. The first time the Scorched Earth scout hits the designated prey in a round, they deal an additional 1d8 precision damage. The Scorched Earth scout also ignores the penalty for making ranged attacks within their second range increment. These effects last until the Scorched Earth scout uses Hunt Prey again.

Hsh9yw0IW6kN2n8t.name: Electrified Blood
Hsh9yw0IW6kN2n8t.description:
Trigger An adjacent creature deals piercing or slashing damage to the sea drake

Effect An arc of electricity courses through the sea drake's blood. The triggering creature takes @Damage[1d6[electricity]] damage.

hTuKXeGWvUSUobx7.name: Ball Lightning Breath
hTuKXeGWvUSUobx7.description:
The sea drake spews a ball of electricity that strikes a primary target within 100 feet, dealing @Damage[6d6[electricity]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save). The lightning then arcs to up to three secondary targets within 30 feet of the primary target, striking the closest available targets first. The secondary bolts each strike one secondary target and deal the same rolled damage value as the primary bolt (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic] save).

The sea drake can't use Ball Lightning Breath again for [[/gmr 1d6 #Recharge Ball Lightning Breath]]{1d6 rounds}.

iWYCpNJjdadjk8JX.name: Briny Wound
iWYCpNJjdadjk8JX.description:
A sea drake's saliva carries a large quantity of salt, making its bite wounds even more painful. When a creature takes damage from a sea drake's jaws Strike, the creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:22] save; the creature is then temporarily immune to briny wound for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is Sickened 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as long as it's sickened.

gBFFibeJFk4MB72C.name: Draconic Frenzy
gBFFibeJFk4MB72C.description: The sea drake makes one jaws Strike and two tail Strikes in any order.

32sJ45kKGClodunO.name: Smoldering Stench
32sJ45kKGClodunO.description:
5 feet. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:19] save.

Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to for 1 minute.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

UUaxUn8e1vkuaaXd.name: Slow
UUaxUn8e1vkuaaXd.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

MBoQQVoF3ws3HLwy.name: Tangling Kelp
MBoQQVoF3ws3HLwy.description:
Trigger A creature attempts a melee attack against a zombie grindylow with a bludgeoning or slashing weapon

Effect The creature must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:13] saving throw or become tangled in the kelp that surrounds the zombie grindylow, giving the creature a -10 circumstance penalty to its Speeds until it spends a manipulate action to remove the kelp.

7Dwwk4c4cBxweZKc.name: Blood Scent (Imprecise) 30 feet
7Dwwk4c4cBxweZKc.description: A mandragora can smell creatures with blood as an imprecise sense at a range of 30 feet, and it can smell demons, fey, and sorcerers with blood as a precise sense at a range of 30 feet.

eTTWHexqpmKAYC0k.name: Blood Drain
eTTWHexqpmKAYC0k.description:
Requirements The mandragora has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The mandragora drains blood from the creature it has grabbed, dealing [[/r {1d6}]]{1d6 damage}. If the creature is a demon, fey, or sorcerer, the mandragora gains temporary Hit Points equal to the damage dealt. A creature that has its blood drained by a mandragora is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} until it receives healing of any kind or amount.

Xlbal6st53Tv5z83.name: Bruorsivi Sap Infusion
Xlbal6st53Tv5z83.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:18]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage and stupefied 1 (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[fire]] damage and stupefied 1 (1 round)

IOvxdhkIi0W0wzzB.name: Piercing Shriek
IOvxdhkIi0W0wzzB.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The mandragora emits an unsettling shriek. Each non-mandragora creature within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[will|dc:20] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is sickened 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. As long as the creature remains sickened, this slowed condition value can't be reduced below 1.

wChn2PEw9GYziq2n.name: Glow
wChn2PEw9GYziq2n.description: 20 feet. Urkhas is itself naturally invisible, but glows with a violet light, casting bright light in the aura and making it visible.

3Eksrmh390T4SrP7.name: Magic Immunity
3Eksrmh390T4SrP7.description: Urkhas is immune to all spells except @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HRb2doyaLtaoCfi3]{Faerie Fire}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0qaqksrGGDj74HXE]{Revealing Light}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Force Barrage}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Oj1PJBMQD9vuwCv7]{Quandary}, and spells with the good trait.

F8xpT7h5a5ZviXU5.name: Feed on Fear
F8xpT7h5a5ZviXU5.description:
Requirements An enemy is being affected by a fear effect or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying} within 15 feet of the will-o'-wisp.

Effect Urkhas feeds on the creature's terror. It regains @Damage[1d4[healing]] Hit Points, and if it has Gone Dark, its glow reignites.

Urkhas can take this action only once per round.

USCoVo5LJNs12zB4.name: Go Dark
USCoVo5LJNs12zB4.description: Urkhas extinguishes its glow, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}. It can end this effect with another use of this action. If it uses its shock attack while invisible, the arc of electricity lets any observer determine its location, making the Urkhas only @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} to all observers until it moves.

NPuaTmC7cWgaNoCB.name: Sneak Attack
NPuaTmC7cWgaNoCB.description: Scorched Earth orcs deal an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

M8kfkkn8DehUAWGA.name: Tethered Shot
M8kfkkn8DehUAWGA.description:
Frequency once per round

The Scorched Earth sharpshooter makes a ranged Strike, firing an arrow attached to a line at a creature in range.

If it hits, in addition to taking @Damage[(1d8+4)[piercing]] damage, that creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:20] save, with the following effects.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 minute or until it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes}(DC 20).

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature is pulled 5 feet toward the sharpshooter.

llP0iPm4qwoX8UZ6.name: Smoke Vision
llP0iPm4qwoX8UZ6.description: The corrupted wildfire ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

K2357WczpsewBpx1.name: Acrid Cloud
K2357WczpsewBpx1.description:
The burning sap that makes up the corrupted wildfire's body sputters and pops, ejecting a cloud of acrid that smoke in a @Template[emanation|distance:10] that lasts for 1 round.

This smoke provides concealment to all creatures within, and deals @Damage[1d6[poison]|options:area-damage] damage to any creature that enters or begins its turn in the cloud (@Check[fortitude|dc:20|basic|options:area-effect]).

A creature that fails is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

DdBcbOs69kmUVmkm.name: Filthy Burn
DdBcbOs69kmUVmkm.description: When the corrupted wildfire successfully strikes a creature with an attack that deals persistent fire damage, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical hit). This condition cannot be reduced below 1 while the creature is subject to the persistent fire damage from the attack, and ends automatically when the persistent fire ends.

OKP4s7Kvgo3TmEds.name: Crumble
OKP4s7Kvgo3TmEds.description:
Trigger The ash skeleton is critically hit

Effect The ash skeleton crumbles to ash, and the attack deals only normal damage

Y4JoZETjAkK132eZ.name: Ash Form
Y4JoZETjAkK132eZ.description:
The ash skeleton crumbles to ash or reforms in a standing position.
